Summary: They remodeled. All our requests for extra towels, pillows, and spices were properly made. Check-in was easy, we pulled up to the valet, and there was someone there to check us in from our car. Happy hour was great from 4 to 7. We will return again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us! We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary: Nice stay, rooms were clean and comfortable.  We had a 1 bedroom with a living room, kitchen and small balcony.  Not too far from Disney, it's walkable or you can go right across the street to the Toy Story parking lot and shuttle in for free.  They are completely renovating the pool area so it was closed down.  This was a little bit of a downside but we knew this going in so I can't be too upset.  One star taken off due to the high pressure to attend a presentation.  We have owned for almost 10 years and don't know why they still push this, I don't mind being offered to go but once I say no that should be it.  After about 10 mintues of repeatedly telling the lady no I just started walking away and told her I was done.  She finally got the picture then proceeded to tell me all
Manager Response: We‚Äôre sorry to learn that our current renovations impacted your stay. While they are a necessary part of ensuring our guests have the best possible experience for years to come, it is never our intention to disrupt current vacationers. We will make sure to pass your feedback regarding this and your sales presentation experience along to resort management so we may continue to improve our guests experiences. Thank you for your feedback and we hope to welcome you back during your next visit to the area.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Worldmark Anaheim for 6 nights.  There were 4 of us, including my elderly mother, who is a Worldmark owner.  Our experience was mostly positive - the front desk staff was very nice and helpful, as was the valet.  We had pre-ordered groceries and the front desk held them for us, and a nice young man brought all of our luggage and groceries up to our room for us after a lengthy check in process.    The check in part is smooth, the worst part is the upselling with the timeshare that you are subjected to after check in.  They immediately started badgering my mother to attend one of their sales meetings and would not take no for an answer.  She is an owner with my father, who was not with us for this trip, so they said she can't "make any changes to their
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We're sorry to hear of your experience with the resort sales team. It is our goal to provide timeshare information in a comfortable and enjoyable environment, and we see that wasn't the case for you. Can you please give us a call at 1-800-457-0103 so we can learn more? We look forward to connecting.

Summary Heading: AWFUL MANAGEMENT! POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! Stay ANYWHERE but here! I wish I could give this place a ZERO!
Summary: We reserved a room here 3 months ago. The day before check-in I added my daughters name as the guest online. She received an email confirmation of the change. Well, she went to check-in the next day, and they said the reservation was cancelled, and they were completely booked!!! Chelsea Harris, Guest Supervisor and Manager, Kimmy Appleby were absolutely NO HELP at all!! My poor daughter sat in the lobby for 45 minutes! I had to pay $1400 to get her a 2 night stay at another hotel, as it was already 10pm at night, and I didn‚Äôt want her to wander into an unsavory area. After posting in a Worldmark group, it appears that this has happened to other members too since the new website launched! Been a Worldmark owner for 20 YEARS!!! After putting my daughter in a precarious situation,
Manager Response: We‚Äôre terribly sorry to learn about your cancelled reservation. While we strive to accommodate all of our guests, unfortunately sometimes we do fall short. When we do, we try to make it right. Can you please call our Owner Care team at 1-800-457-0103 so we can learn more about your experience? It is our goal to resolve this matter to your satisfaction and encourage you to update your review afterwards. We look forward to connecting.

Summary: The unit was very nicely decorated, very clean and we were able to see Disneyland from our balcony. Really enjoyed the pool and the Starbucks in the lobby. Only down fall was the fact they wouldn‚Äôt let my significant other attend the timeshare meeting. When I signed up I told them he would be attending not me and they said fine, but them turned him away. But overall it was a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your overall visit, and your feedback surrounding the sales presentation will be shared with resort management.

Summary: Thank god we didn‚Äôt pay for it, so that was the only good thing. Yes, the only good thing is we didn‚Äôt pay because it was a gift. Let me start off by saying we all know how the presentation scam works. We get it, we know where our maintenance fees etc go‚Ä¶.. commissions to the ‚Äúconcierge ‚Äú these people lie and tell you the parks open at any hour that will make them get you to presentation. I get it. I would rather eat my own feces than ever sit through that crap for less money than I make an hour now. Why would anyone?! So after that lie, we cancelled because how can anyone do business with liars? Second thing the ‚Äúexceed guest expectations‚Äù service from the ‚Äúconcierge‚Äù was to call and try again to suck blood by waking my whole family up at 7:45 to see if we wanted to lose money
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear of your experience with the sales presentation. You are free to decline any sales presentations and forfeit the gift. If you feel the sales presentation was concerning, please give us a call at 1-800-251-8736 so we can learn more.

Summary: This is my 3rd time coming to this hotel. Love it so much. The upgrades they did over the years looks amazing and yes there is a Starbucks in the building...HELLO!! Complete game changer. The rooms were clean and smell clean. Staff was welcoming. We love coming here. The bus to the parks is $6 per adult for all day, so worth it. The only thing is the beds are firm and I am use to soft mattress. Other then that we loved it!! We will definitely come back this will be our go to hotel to stay!! ü•∞ü•∞ü•∞
Room tip: During the week are the best times to book a stay. Cheesecake Factory is one block over. If your...
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us. We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary: This is a great home base for Disneyland visit.      The updated rooms are very nice.    The parking garage is right next door.   The Starbucks & shop in the lobby are very convenient for a quick bite or snacks.     There are a number of restaurants in walking distance at Anaheim Garden walk like Cheesecake Factory & Huckleberry's.     The fireworks from Disney can be seen from the balcony.     Staff was very friendly, especially the young lady who checked us in.

Summary Heading: LOVE this resort üòç Already booked to come back in 2022üòòüòò
Summary: Ok I must say I am loving the upgrades to the room. My mom and I came here in 2017 I do believe and it was...ok. But we booked again 2 weeks ago and we are loving Wyndham Anaheim. The room was clean. Everything was remodel and we was able to get a balcony. I have a timeshare with this resort and it's so convenient. We took the shuttle for the first time to Disneyland.  Saved our feet!!. I love that it picks you up in the front. And let's not talk about the cafe that serve Starbucks coffee...game changer!! The staff was super nice and we felt at home and safe. Did I mention Cheesecake Factory is across the street...HELLO! My kind of town üòò
Room tip: The park was super busy in October. I am sure it's because of the holidays and the fact that...
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us at WorldMark Anaheim. We are so glad to hear you enjoy the renovations. Our team works diligently to make your stay wonderful, so we love to hear from guests such as yourself. Thank you so much for leaving your review, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Let's just say I wouldn't pay for it.
Summary: Pros: Clean rooms, has the kitchen essentials, rooms were quiet, nicely decorated, coffee lovers will enjoy the Starbucks in the lobby, has a washer and dryer in the room, great for families., last but not least friendly staff. Cons: Garage seems to not be policed in regards to the specialty spots, overpriced, too far for Disneyland to walk, Art bus is always full when trying to board, elevators in the garage are SUPER slow. When we arrived our rooms were not ready so they took our belongings and stored them until they were. When we came back they had them placed in the rooms which was nice. The parking garage isn't policed that we could tell because they have 3 oversized vehicle spaces and more often then not cars that were WELL below the max height for the garage were parked
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us at WorldMark Anaheim. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the onsite amenities, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Clean and comfortable.  Staff is very helpful and accommodating.  Great view.  We were able to watch the Disney Fireworks the night we arrived.  Park entrance is easily walkable, but I had a leg injury and needed a scooter.  Hotel staff recommendation (Soaring Scooters) was excellent.  The ART shuttle was cheap and efficient.  I was initially skeptical, but would not hesitate to ride it in the future.  The apps you need to both buy a ticket and to request an unscheduled ride are a bit confusing, but worked well once you figured it out.  This would be my first choice of a place to say anytime i visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving your kind review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Check AC is functional before accepting the room. Our unit along with many other units had a faulty AC that was never functional during our 7 night stay. Room 1012. The fact that fans are readily available should be a sign that this is a known problem in the hotel. The evening technician is aware of the problem, but front desk manager and morning technicians don‚Äôt resolve the problem.  BTW, I am an owner, not just a hotel guest and this is how we are treated.
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear the AC was not functioning during your stay. We strive to create the best possible vacation for all of our guests and are disappointed that we missed the mark this time. We appreciate your feedback and will be sure to pass it along to our leadership team and resort management so we may resolve this issue in the future. Thank you.

Summary: Stayed at a huge 3 br/2ba condo and WE LOVED IT! Resort itself is clean and bustling with staff to help ppl and keep place immaculate. Recently remodeled. Close to DL, 15-20 min walk, 5 minute shuttle ride ($6/pp).  Minimarket in lobby for Starbucks coffees and small items to take to your room.  Small boutique with Disney items in lobby, too.  Room was spacious and perfect, although it was a bummer we overlooked the street and not the pool.  Nevertheless, it's clean and my two teenagers loved that they each had their own space with a tv.  Across the street are Avis and Hertz car rental outfits.  WMA is also surrounded by restaurants from whom you can place mobile orders and pick-up:  CPK, Habit, PF Changs and more.  Pool area was a decent size and clean.  Reservations are

I could not have been more pleased with our stay at this property. We exchanged through RCI booking a couple weeks. Management was so accommodating of our needs and the front desk staff could not of been friendlier or more helpful. The property was kept immaculately and the room was great and very comfortable. Would not hesitate to stay here again!

We stayed here with our grandkids and had a great time. They are pool and hot tub enthusiasts so they loved it here. There are currently restricted hours of using the pool ‚Äî but great fun. It is a longish walk to downtown Disney but no problem‚Äî straight down Katella Ave. there isn‚Äôt a restaurant I t he hotel but a nice variety of places nearby.  The hotel is clean and well decorated. Our two bedroom unit had a full  kitchen.

The property location was perfect and the amenities were very nice! The staff was also very friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be back to the property and highly recommended this for families.

I was here on an RCI timeshare swop. It was with the hope of a Disney experience, but COVID put paid to that. Anaheim, and its plethora of Disneyland-facing hotels, was a bit of a ghost town with the park/s closed, and the hotel was at low occupancy. Staff tried to create a bit of buzz, but it was kinda dead, although the Presidential election did add some spice. That said, the hotel is well positioned as a base to go shopping, head to the coast from, or road trip inland to Palm Springs (as I did). The one-bed suite I was in had a great 13th floor vantage, so try get a high floor. It is fairly vanilla set-up, but very well-equipped, comfortable and super practical. The pool area is large and top notch, and the hot tubs on the roof could also be fun (outside of a pandemic). So

We have been Worldmark owners about 15 years. In those 15 years we have stayed at a lot of Worldmark/Wyndham properties, west coast, east coast, Hawaii, Canada, etc. We have probably stayed at the Anaheim location the most, we would consider ourselves a Disney family. We have stayed in studios, one bedrooms and two bedrooms. There have never been any complaints, everything is continuously being updated. Our last trip was a bit stressful and the Worldmark staff made it so much easier. Our luggage didn't make it to us on an airport transfer and we had no personal hygiene items, or extra clothing. (I know, we should have had a carry on with that but didn't.) The front desk found out what happened and gave us toothbrushes, deodorant, toothpaste, combs, etc. Thankfully, with the

Summary Heading: Pool, Excellent Room, Perfect Proximity, Shuttle
Summary: Family trip to Disney in the cold and rain. One of the better parts of the adventure was the clean, close and nice place to stay at WorldMark Anaheim. When the weather was good we were able to walk to food and to the park. When we needed to get out of the weather the shuttle was a welcome blessing. Small but nice workout room too!

It was a perfect location for a Disneyland vacation!  They take great care of you and have staff to help with bags.  You can park for a $10 daily fee.   It was really easy to buy shuttle tickets to Disneyland that lets you come and go as many times as you want all day. The shuttle drops you off right in front of the gates and right outside the front of the hotel. The rooms are nice and the pool is beautiful.  We loved the large hot tub.

Great location close walk to the park. I stay at various World Marks and this is one of the bests. There are several restaurants close by. Pool is nice staff is great the room is like being in a condo

Here are the pros: I'm a Worldmark owner so the stay was on points, the pool and hot tub were clean, the room is spacious, there is a kitchen and washer/dryer.   The cons: The mattress is hard, the internet not only didn't work...but they clearly were blocking cell signal to force you to BUY their internet, the furniture and carpet are ugly, there is no free shuttle like most places have ($6 per person per ride), and the sales tactics are pushy and obnoxious. In particular they promised me a bottle of wine (that I did NOT solicit but they kept offering so I said yes) and it never was given AND they put you through a rah-rah we're so awesome sales pitch and then play games with how long they say it will take. They said it would be over in an hour at 8:30 by 9 I said I'm leaving.

We just had a lovely 2 night stay here at Worldmark Anaheim  The rooms were exceptionally clean inviting and equipped  We stayed in the 2 bedroom units Their were 10 of us there was a tv in each bedroom and lounge The only downside is that you have to pay for WIFI unless you are in the lobby Worrh each cent tho Great pools/Spa  Would definitely return as it is close to everything

I am an owner with Wyndam Vacation Club so I was able to book this 1 bedroom condo using points and only $100 incidental hold on the card at check in.  Check in was easy.  Room was clean and spacious.  Pool looked great (didn‚Äôt get to use since we spent most of our time in Disneyland). But the resort is walking distance from The Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Gump Shrimp.  Disneyland is 1 mile away from the resort. We accessed the park using the ART bus system (you can purchase bus day passes from the resort lobby).  Only a 5 min bus ride to the park will save you  the $40  parking fee. I love being able to access other condos when I travel and if I go back to Anaheim will definitely book here first.  Disclosure: I had to book this 6 months out because the condos do book up

The room is very spacious, large bedrooms and bathrooms.  In suite laundry. Very clean.  Nice little gift store in the lobby.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  We could see the fireworks at Disneyland from our room which was a bonus.  20 minutes to Disneyland and lots of great restaurants along the way.

We had a great room in a great location near Disneyland. We were able to walk daily to and from the park. Area felt safe. Room was clean and stocked. Only downside was the push to make us attend a timeshare presentation, they don‚Äôt take no for an answer the first time. Be persistent and say no thank you.

I was a sponsored guest at the resort through my brother-in-law's timeshare with Wyndham Resorts.  I was only about to give the place  4-stars but what made it to perfection is the superb customer service skills of the front desk specialist, ABEL.  I checked out 4:30 am on a Sunday and all I can say about the able ABEL is phenomenal.  Top notch impeccable service through and through.  ABEL treats you like family and very supportive every step of the way.  The resort itself and the rooms are nowhere close to luxury but it is every bit functional and comfortable and more importantly, in very close proximity to Disneyland.  Clean rooms, comfortable beds and very responsive staff from maintenance all the way to ABEL made our stay more than pleasant.  WorldMark mngt. should put ABEL

Summary Heading: Newly renovated, huge suites and close to Disneyland
Summary: My dad is a Worldmark owner and we didn't realize there was a location so close to Disneyland.   It's about 20 mins if you want to walk it otherwise purchasing the unlimited ride shuttle ART bus is fantastic. Comes every 20 mins of the hour as early as 20 mins before disneyland magic morning hour opening and up to 30 mins after closing hours. Reduced fares for kids and seniors (over 65). We bought 5 day passes for adult was $23, senior $8, kid $5.   Rooms and the hotel overall look newly renovated. The rooms definitely were modernized and look bright and new. Our suite had a kitchen and two bedrooms and 2 bath and the whole layout was huge. Much bigger than what we anticipated. Each bedroom had blackout shades which was helpful for the kids needing to nap during the day. Each

Summary Heading: One of the best places we have stayed at. And close to Disney!
Summary: This is our fourth time coming to Disney as a family. We drive out from Texas almost every year for spring break. We have stayed at different places each time. This was the best hands down! We stayed in a two bedroom condo, had a king size in one room and two twins in the other room. Living room had a pull out sofa but we just sat on it and never used it as a bed. Full kitchen, and a washer and dryer in the room. The beds were so comfy as well! My kids loved the pool area! Its an outdoor pool but the water is heated so even though it wasn't hot outside the pool was still comfortable to get into. They also had two hot-tubs in the pool area. Those were really nice. We did watch the Disneyland fireworks from the roof one night, which has two hot tubs as well. The staff was very

Nice and spacious rooms but a bit dated.  Friendly staff.  Good wifi.  Nice to have a kitchen and eat breakfast in the room.  All of the main car rental places are within walking distance.. Successfully said no to the timeshare presentation.    Tip - If you are in good health skip the bus and walk. It's never on time, always packed, and stops running just after the park closes.

I stayed here for a week with my family in a three bedroom.  One bedroom had a kind bed, one had a queen and the other had two twins. The master bathroom was average size with the main bathroom being much bigger and also contained a washer/dryer in the closet.  While it was perfect for a family of four I was a little disappointed with the twin bed situation.  I was expecting two queen beds in the third room as initially we were supposed to have seven people in total.  The living room and kitchen were perfect and the size of the unit was perfectly fine for us.  The concierge staff was very helpful.  Being that it is a timeshare I was expecting them to be pushy, but they  did not bother us at all.  They were very helpful with recommendations.  Although we did not use the pool

Stayed on the eighth floor facing Disney, over looking the pool, where we got excellent views of the nightly fireworks. If you plan on cooking pizza, bring/buy your own pizza wheel as the resort doesn't offer it.  The tub/shower drain backed up a bit and the temperature of the water fluctuates, so you'll need to be fast. There is some construction still going so you'll need a white noise generator if you plan on sleeping in. It got pretty loud.

Average accomodation with parking. Great location,with reasonable amenities. Service is Ok . Staff tried to be friendly but it seemed a bit plastic after a while.The room had good space , washing machine and dryer ,large fridge but the cooking items were limited. The finishes were very suitable for families but if you have a higher expectation it is not luxurious at all. It really caters to Disney visitors with a shuttle to assist families.

Magnificent property; clean, well maintained, well appointed. Staff friendly and professional.. 1.5 miles away from Disney; $5.50 all day shuttle makes transport a breeze. You can't find a better deal.

The front desk was very helpful. Being a last-minute trip I was going to have to change rooms, but man #1 told me there was another family in the same boat and he could arrange it so neither of us had to change rooms. This also saved on a second cleaning fee. Then man #2 offered me a glass of wine. He was very nice and upbeat even when I told him that six months before I had purchased more credits and absolutely was not going to do it again.  He said for a $50 gift card and breakfast I could have a 15 minute survey. I had actually participated in one of these before so I knew that it could be real.  When I made my appointment the sales person insisted that I get breakfast and it wasn‚Äôt all that great. Sausage, watery eggs, hard French toast. We went up to his desk on another

We stayed here for a total of eight dates in December 2018. Our stay here was very comfortable. All of the staff, including those at reception and the cleaning personnel, were very professional and friendly. If we needed anything, they were happy to help out immediately. The room was quite spacious. As with other hotels, the carpet was not particularly clean and our feet became black. However, this appears to be par for the course these days because hotels do not routinely shampoo their carpets.  But that is a relatively minor quibble.   It should also be noted that we found alcoholic drinks and sodas in one of the cupboards. Therefore, when these rooms are cleaned and checked, it is not as if they go over every inch. Otherwise, this Worldmark is very convenient to Disneyland‚Ä¶

We stayed in a 2br/2 br apartment and it was great. Everything you need to stay comfortably. Bus  8 out the front door and you can even buy your bus ticket in the building. Nice little touches like free coffee in morning and cold water/lemon drink during day. Staff are great and very accommodating. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to families. It was a shame that they were renovating on our floor, but the staff did everything possible to assist us.

We stayed at Worldmark Anaheim from Nov 3 -10, 2018 for our trip to Disneyland.  I traded in through my timeshare with RCI to get this two bedroom, two bathroom condo apartment.  We were somewhat nervous about what our stay would be like as sometimes you do not get exactly what you expect when you are with RCI but were pleasantly surprised.  We booked well in advance of our trip (which if you want the side of the building facing Disneyland that definitely helps from what I was told- the farther out you book it the better chance you land a room facing that way.  We booked in Jan/Feb 2018 for Nov 2018).  We landed a room on the 10th floor facing Disney and were able to watch the fireworks right from our balcony.  There is also a rooftop patio with hot tubs and tables where anyone

Summary Heading: Great resort walking distance from Disneyland!
Summary: I've been a WorldMark owner for many years and absolutely love staying at the WorldMark Anaheim.  The location can't be beat.  It's walking distance from Disneyland with several restaurants nearby.  They also do not charge or parking which is a definite bonus.  Each time we've stayed the rooms have been very clean.  There's a great upper deck with 2 hot tubs that you can watch the fireworks from each night.  We will definitely be staying here again in the future.

The place is newly renovated, but you can tell they cut corners. The room, living room and kitchen was wonderful with new appliances. The tub and shower not soo much. The washer/dryer was old and dirty. You are better off not washing your clothes. This is one of my favorite things in wyndham, being able to wash clothes, but very disappointed.

Summary Heading: Close to a lot of restaurants and to Disneyland
Summary: We were able to walk to a lot of restaurants and also to Disneyland (where we didn't have to pay for parking). The hotel was well kept and the staff were friendly.  I like that they had drinking water in the lobby for the guests.  The only thing was the construction going on in the building.

Summary Heading: Great location but rooms are not up to par
Summary: Being an owner we stayed here for 12 days in a 3 bedroom.  The rooms are run down and not kept up.  We have stayed her when it 1st opened and a few times after that and it was much nicer.  It seems that owners don‚Äôt care how the rooms are treated and don‚Äôt report things that are wrong in the units. The mattresses are so bard it seems I always leave with back pain.

I stayed with a friend who is a member. So this is an unbiased opinion. Our room was straight out of 1982. Which is strange since I think the timeshare has been built since then. initially it was great. John checked us in at night. And John was super helpful and happy and a great person to check you in. But then the next day the front desk gal was super snarky with me told me that everything I've been told that before was wrong. That there was no Wi-Fi in the lobby like we had been shown on our brochure. And that if my kids took the pool towels out of the hotel we would be charged $25 a towel. Supposedly there are secret microchips inside the towels. We had to prop our door open to our room with a towel, because it made a whistling sound all night. The washer and dryer were in

We have had an awesome stay at this hotel. It has suited our family of 3 perfectly - we stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment which has plenty of room, 2 good sized bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen/meals/lounge, washer & dryer. Pool area is basic but clean & has spa & bbq‚Äôs. We were asked to attend a timeshare presentation when we arrived, we nicely but firmly said no and were not asked again. Staff are super friendly and helpful and greet all guests as they come & go.  Easy 10min walk to Disney Parks or bus is at the front of the hotel. Restaurants, cafes & basic shopping is all within a 5 min walk.  The hotel is exactly as described. We can‚Äôt really fault it.

We are owners who arranged for family from all over the world to stay. Love the location for Disneyland and some of the beaches. We joined them for an information breakfast which was meant to be 90 minutes but was closer to 120. Breakfast basic but ok still tried to upsell but the pleasure was on lower end of scale. Accommodation  great unit has everything you need, full kitchen plus washer and dryer.

We are a family of 5, 4 adults and one toddler and we stayed for 10 days at the end of August into September and could not fault the hotel. Yes we were asked to do the tour but declined and only one phone call checking in the whole time to make sure we didn‚Äôt want to participate. We had a 2 bedroom and there was plenty of room. The view from our room we could see the fireworks. We walked to Disneyland several times towards the end of our stay we caught the bus. Had a fantastic family holiday and definitely would book again.

Summary Heading: Renovations above our room were incredibly noisy
Summary: We are Worldmark owners and stayed there for 6 nights from Monday 17th September. We were placed on level 4 when level 5 was being remodelled. We were woken up at 8:50am on Thursday by jackhammering and hammering directly above our heads that was so loud we couldn't even talk to one another. We were not warned to expect the level of noise we endured. It was not on our confirmation nor was it mentioned on check in nor is it on the Worldmark website. It took 2 calls to reception where I was fobbed off and told to deal with it. I then went to reception and finally got help from the General Manager who helped us switch rooms to the 12th floor. While I was trying to pack up I had someone that was assisting the sales team calling me trying to harrass me into sitting a sales meeting

The rooms are just lovely.  We had a room that had both pool views and over to Disneyland.   Was able to watch the fireworks each night before the kids went to bed.  Very professional.  Stayed their three weeks while we toured around the West Coast of America.

Very nice resort.  Very clean and all the employees are friendly and helpful.  The carpet in the room was good, but really needed updating.  Many of the units were being updated while we were there.  We had a good well-equipped room so we were able to go out to fine restaurants and bring left-overs for the next day's lunch.  Very nice hotel / resort, but we did not use the pool, etc.  Our unit had a nice balcony to sit out and watch the Disney fireworks at night, however most units have a tiny balcony to stand out on only.  Overall, we had a great time here.

Apparently Worldmark is remodeling each floor.  We didn't care too much but the noise when we were in our room was unbearable.  Sounded like jackhammers above us.  The pool area is great and the staff is very attentive.  We were not pressured into a "free breakfast i.e. sales pitch) so that was nice but hopefully the remodel will go quickly cause the noise was too much.  Other than that, the location to Disneyland and shuttle service is perfect.

Summary Heading: Book for the location avoid the "update"
Summary: To start off this review the hotel is doing a complete remodel one floor at a time. We stayed on the 4th floor while reno going on on the 5th. Did not bother us as they kept to good hours. The front desk staff is always my favorite. Always welcoming and helpful. This is about where is ends with the staff. Every time I stay here I tell myself I will not sit through the "owner update meeting". I normally succeed but this time I wanted to know what was going on as the gal that was booking me told me that the resort has split from Wyndham. As an owner that paid a lot of money to be an "owner" this was news to me and shocking. She also advised that I need to be put into the new system since I had not attended an owner meeting in some time. red flag red flag red flag!!! I decided that

Clean rooms about 1 mile from Disney. Lots of dining options in the local area as well as the Garden Walk. My only complaints are they charge $190 in taxes when you check in and they do not service rooms if you are staying less than 9 days.

Stayed here for 2 nights for a 3 day Disney trip. What a great location, clean rooms, and free parking. Two bedrooms (room with twins can be converted to a king), two bathrooms, full kitchen, and living room. This will be my go to for any Anaheim stays.

This was a perfect location for the Convention center and Disney. 10-15 minute walk or a $6 Uber. Pool and hot tubs are wonderful. Hot tub on the rooftop to watch Disney firework show. Fabulous restaurants within one or two blocks and shopping too. All around a great place to stay. Clean and friendly service.

I was convinced to sit through a timeshare lecture said to take 90 minutes and I would receive $100 gift card and breakfast.   I checked in and sat in the lobby for 30 min while every other couple got taken into their meetings.  Nobody ever offered me anything and as my brother and his wife went upstairs the employee said "you won't be forgotten".  30 minutes later I was forgotten.  A couple that didn't have ID and couldn't check in, were still given breakfast for them and their 6 kids... disappointed by the level of customer service from this company!

Summary Heading: The reason to stay here is Disneyland!
Summary: Worldmark is close to Disneyland.  Makes getting to the park easy.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  It's nice to have a full service room, so you can make your own meals without having to eat Disney food.  It's really great if your planning more than one day to the park.  Lots of near by dinning.

Best thing is it's walking distance to Disneyland.  This was our 2nd stay in 7 months and 3rd all time).  Go to the roof to watch Disneyland fireworks at night.  Lots of Restaurants in the area.  Close to stores and entertainment.  Rooms are great and staff is friendly.

Excellent value and great room amenities. Staff could not be more helpful. Hotel amenities with decks, hot tubs etc. great. Great location for shopping and dinning as well as just a short walk to Disneyland. Bonus was that we had a room overlooking Disneyland. Highly recommend.

Great setup for Disney,  buy bus pass inside takes you on a short ride from Wyndham front door to main gate.   Rooms are nice,  service very good,  free and secure parking.  Pool is nice.  Entertainment game room,  5 Minute walk to good restaurants if that.

Amazing room with kitchen, two bathrooms, and plenty of space for a family of 6. The rooms were exceptionally clean and the staff were extremely helpful, polite, and went out of their way to satisfy our every need. This place ticked all the boxes for us.

Summary Heading: Just be honest and nobody gets hurt
Summary: Stayed in Anaheim and concierge recommended 60-minute presentation at the Worldmark Anaheim for new Wyndham resort properties. The gift incentive is a $100 American Express card and free breakfast. The 4-bedroom suite was gorgeous and the sales rep was awesome to talk with. The business manager was just as pleasant, no pressure selling relatively speaking from past presentations at other resorts. Their main ding is at the exit  office, the rep gave me a Disney card as my gift incentive. When I informed her the concierge advised me of the $100 AMEX card, she said they don't normally give those cards. After further discussion with me, she finally whipped out the AMEX card she just so happened to have in her desk. Evidently they give these only to prospective clients that meet

I stayed at this resort with my family during spring break. It was perfect for my kids and I. The pool area was very well kept and clean. The pools were nice and warm. I loved that they had so many options for hot tubs to soak in, either the 2 by the pool or the 2 on the roof!! Every single person I encountered that worked there was very pleasant and professional. I will never forget their staff for as long as I live. They went above and beyond to help me and make sure I was comfortable. Mirza was the most kind person in the world and he deserves a huge raise! Do not ever lose him as an employee. He is a blessing to your company. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for everything you did for me. I highly recommend staying here if you can.   FYI-only downfall was the beds. My

Summary Heading: The worst worldmark we have ever stayed in!
Summary: Let me start by saying that the front desk staff were amazing.  Aside from them though, this is by far the worst worldmark we have stayed in.  Our stay started with the front doors that open out together and nearly smacked us in the face twice.  I truly hope someone realizes this major design flaw and fixes it before someone gets seriously injured.  We stayed in a studio unit and had to move the furniture just to pull the bed down.  The living area was so tiny, that there is literally no place to put the chair and sofa while the bed is down, so we had to climb over the top of the sofa just to get to the bed.  The bathroom was larger than the living area and I have stayed in hotel rooms that were more spacious and nicer.   The burners on the stove did not work and all the drains

Summary Heading: From New Zealand - We stayed twice at Worldmark Anaheim in a period of 4 weeks.
Summary: We stayed twice (three of us) at Worldmark Anaheim in a period of 4 weeks.  Melissa and the front Desk crew including the Lovely House manager were outstanding in their professionalism, posture and grace and their warm hearted smiles.  This team with their humbleness and 'realness' made our Apartment stay all the more fantastic, we were well taken care of, we felt special, supported by the sweet spirited, down to earth staff attitude who made us feel like we had a luxury home away from home, sincerely and truthfully showed the good ol' traditional wild west, California hospitality at it's' best as I remember it as a teenager.  This was not an opportunity to find fault. it was a smooth sail and a tight ship.  No other holiday accommodation can even could come close.  Five star

Summary Heading: Typical shady timeshare salespeople and presentation
Summary: Checked into Desert Palms down the street. Was given a ticket to 'spin the wheel' in the lobby upon check in. No one ever mentioned it was for a time share and there is nothing to indicate that it is. I spun the wheel and won a 'free' nights stay at a Wyndham property. She then said we had to go to a short breakfast the next morning and we would also get a $75 'Disney' gift card. It took almost 10 minutes to deal with this as all the information wasn't forthcoming from Danielle. I had just driven 7 hours to get there and I wanted to get to my room. She told us we would get a free "gourmet" breakfast and would be out of there by 930a. No later. I specifically asked as she said we had to be at the Wyndham Worldmark down the street at 8a and it would be a 90 minute presentation.

We're local Long Beach residents who ran out for a quick overnight family bonding trip.  Our son is moving up to Washington state so we spent some quality time.  Our two bedroom unit was not available on a Sunday until 4:45pm which make it a bit frustrating inasmuch as we only had overnight.  We walked down to the Garden Walk and had lunch and spent time at the bowling place until 4pm.  Many times we are able to get into our unit early, but not this time.  The unit was fine, furnishings are getting tired but all in all we enjoyed our time here.  I with they would not be so aggresive pushing the "owner update" every time.

This was a pleasant surprise. The walk to Disneyland is approx. a mile along quiet streets. Which is not bad except after a long day of walking around the park...The staff are friendly. The rooms are clean and well kept. The gym was a nice bonus for getting my run in. The only bad thing was the parking is in an attached garage area and so getting your luggage inside is a task. Otherwise this is a great option if you own Worldmark points.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 8 days, leaving on the 8th morning. We arrived early the first day and our apartment was ready which was great.  Our apartment was never refreshed with towels linen etc. Quite disappointed. No refreshment of soaps, shampoo etc. You could have asked at the desk, but surely if reception knew you had booked for 8 days, it would have been a given to come and tidy and refresh room. The rooftop overlooking the fireworks at Disney is great. Spas, gas heaters etc.The day before we were leaving I asked if they could book us a bus or taxi. 'No' - you do that yourself.

We stayed 4 nights at WorldMark while visiting Disneyland. It was my fist time at a WorldMark property and I was impressed. Our 2 bedroom was very comfortable for 4 adults and 1 child. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook breakfasts and dinner. The ice maker wasn't turned on before our arrival like I'm told they normally have at other properties, it was a minor inconvenience. I'm surprised the facility doesn't have an ice maker anywhere besides the rooms.   We had a room on the 10th floor facing the parks and had a great view of the fireworks.   The bathtubs were fine for children but not usable for the adults.  The Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) bus stops right outside and is very convenient.   If you're driving, be aware that the front of the building does not

Summary Heading: Great Location Great Room Great Staff
Summary: We came to this property by using our time share that we own w/a different company. We were treated like valued guests. We requested a top floor facing the fireworks and were not disappointed w/the 16th floor and beautiful views. We were able to see the fireworks almost nightly. The staff were very accommodating and were able to get us extra amenities as needed at no extra charge. We did agree to sign up for their membership presentation but when one of us couldn't make it they were more than understanding and were not pressuring. The room was clean, had what we needed and the beds were comfortable. The hide a bed was a little squeaky but if that is the worse thing that happened to us, we will take it! We enjoyed the daily convenience of the shuttle that was a small cost for our

We stayed in this hotel through Wyndham on a family holiday, we stayed in a 3 bedroom unit. We arrived after a 14 hour flight from New Zeland and arrived at the hotel around 0800am, we had to wait around until 1400hrs to check in even though we had emailed in advance, our kids were so tired they slept in a lounge area until our room was ready. If I had of known it would of been an issue I would of booked for the night before our arrival as well.  The hotel itself was very tidy and the disneyland bus stopped outside the hotel however we walked every day. Disneyland was very busy during this time and we had to wait for upto 3 hours to get on a ride even at night, we only used 2 out of 5 day pass for this reason, we went to Knotts Berry farm one day by bus and there were no lines

Really enjoyed the facility and the room was very nice.. would have liked to see a better bathing tub as there was space for something like a whirlpool but it was a tiny 5 ft you barely fit into.. other than Hat the room was spacious, the facility very friendly and free parking..

We stayed here so that we could visit Disneyland for two days.  Convenience is a huge factor as you can walk to the park easily.  The rooms are nicely furnished and in great condition.  The front desk staff was extremely helpful.  We had a couple of items shipped to us while staying there and they quickly let us know when things arrived.  Check in and Check out were extremely efficient.  Pool facility is nice for when you want to wind down after a day at the parks.  If you are up high enough you can see Disney fireworks from your room but you can also go to the rooftop hot tubs if you want to see them as well.  Finally, parking is free and on site.
Manager Response: Dear Gus,  Thank you for the great review of our resort! We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and are grateful you took the time to post a review. Our staff a Anaheim is wonderful, we love them too.  I am glad you got to watch the fireworks, they are pretty spectacular. We look forward to you visiting with us again.

Summary: We stayed at WorldMark Anaheim for one week. We had a two-bedroom unit, which was a common dining/living area with a bedroom on each side of it. One bedroom had a king-sized bed and en-suite bath, and another had twin beds. That bathroom was accessible from the common area for anyone who may be sleeping on the queen-sized sleeper sofa in the living room. We had a small balcony accessible through a sliding glass door, so there was a lot of light coming through.  The kitchen (with stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, coffee pot) was well-stocked with everything you‚Äôd need ‚Äì coffee filters and coffee condiments, dish soap, dishwashing liquid, paper towels, plus tableware/flatware/glasses, etc. and just about anything you‚Äôd need to cook/bake with including basic spices.

It was my first family trip to Los Angeles and I was looking for a destination close to Disneyland. Worldmark Anaheim was a perfect family resort that suited our family needs and location. The location is great with walking distance to the Disneyland theme park and also a shuttle was available from the resort to the park. I think you pay about $5 for a day ride. The resort was clean with facilities such as pool, spa, roof top view to disneyland, gym, business centre, concierge. The staff were friendly and prompt to your needs. The kitchen was fully equiped and very clean. One down side was only one elevator was working neat to our room so that had  bit of delay but was fixed by the end of the day. The roof top provides a great view and i hope that can be open for later too. It

Improvement: Unit was clean (except the carpet) and everything in the unit was in working order.  One elevator was down for a couple of days which increased the wait times.  Then, the elevator in the parking garage was down for a day.  Luckily, it was working the day we checked out.  We were able to catch the elevator to the roof/hot tub area and another family commented that the elevator took more than 10 minutes so they walked all the way up.  I was disappointed in the "remodel" of the roof/hot tub area.  When we travelled here on April 2017, the early morning and ALL day drilling construction was SO disruptive (no sleeping in or afternoon naps) due to the loud vibrating walls.  I expected something spectacular, but it looked the same and lack luster.    Positive: Manager was
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We appreciate positive and negative feedback, it shows us where to improve and where to be consistent. I am sorry about your frustrations with the new Club Wyndham website. The new site is replacing an 10+ year outdated system, we appreciate your patience during this transition. Since we are a Worldmark resort our Worldmark sales team have limited knowledge of Club Wyndham products. I am happy the resort manager was able to keep you in the same room. We are glad you enjoyed the unit and will alert management to clean the carpets.

Summary: We had a great time staying here.  I have a family of four with two kids under the age of 3.  Having a 2 bedroom suite really gave us the space we needed and allowed for separate nap/sleep locations.    The staff is super nice and helpful.  In the evening, they have complimentary self-serve wine.  It was the perfect greeting after long days at the parks.  Small touch, but definitely appreciated.
Manager Response: Hello, We're happy to hear that the 2 bedroom unit worked well for your family, and that our staff took such good care of you during your stay, and that the wine helped you relax after your long days.  We hope you come back again very soon.

Summary: A very good resort. A well staffed concierge desk to help plan your stay. Shuttle to Disneyland and relatively close to Orange County Outlet shops. Multiple swimming areas. Went to an "update" to get a breakfast and a $100 Disneyland voucher, the breakfast was truly AWFUL but the consultant took NO for an answer straight away - that makes a change!

I read some not so nice reviews on this hotel before my trip but had already book the room,  I heard the employees were pushy and rude but that was not my experience. It is a time share hotel and maybe if your an owner it's a different experience I here they try to hard sell the owners to up grade and don't leave you alone about it but as an guest of an owner it wasn't too bad they tried but gave up after the second no and I didn't hear any more about it the whole week we were there. When we got there the room wasn't quiet ready, but within 20m it was ready and our luggage and the groceries we ordered were in the room and the food was put away for us, that was nice.  We had booked two rooms and ask that they be as close together as possible and they were able to put them on the

I stayed at the resort for a week, to go to the happiest place on earth. The check in process was smooth, and I was welcomed with a glass of wine on arrival. The ground floor facilities are great, I needed a few items and there was a convenience shop which had what I needed, an amazing pool area, and a good gym space. My one bedroom was spacious with a murphy bed, full kitchenette with all utensils, crockery, equipment required, washer and dryer (which was extremely helpful), and an enormous bathroom (so much room for one). There is a shopping centre nearby, although not a lot of shops were open (if you are looking for discounted tickets for a number of attractions, there is a shop in the Garden Walk), as well as plenty of restaurants a 5 minute walk away. The hotel also

What an awesome Worldmark Resort!  This resort has everything.  The obvious, a pool, a gym, etc.  The rooms are very nice too. They all have a washer and dryer in every unit.   Always stay in a two-bedroom, but this time we stayed in the 4 bedroom penthouse.  The view is amazing.  We got to go out on the terrace and got the whole Disneyland firework show.  Totally amazing!  The penthouse had a very uppity look.  Impressive.  We went to Disneyland, you can purchase shuttle tickets at the resort.  We also went bowling at night, went to check out the Great Wolf Lodge, looked cool, and then drove to Santa Monica to hang out at the fair on the pier.  Cool 4 day trip trp.  We came back and went swimming after 2 days at Disney, every night.  Fun filled time at a great resort.  The

Stayed here to attend an Army retirement ceremony.  Nice rooms. Love the stocked kitchen. Appreciate being able to open windows and step out on balcony.  Wished the rooftop had been open for use.   I did not shop there or use any of their amenities.   The 2 bedroom is great for families.

Summary Heading: Great property but could do without the pressure to become owner...
Summary: One year ago we signed up to sit for a presentation and decided to become Discovery members.  We purchased some credits to "try out" being an owner for WorldMark.  We stayed at a WorldMark property in Vegas and were VERY disappointed.  We decided to use the rest of our credits and to NOT become an owner.  So, we signed up for a land and sea package.  We chose to stay at the WorldMark Anaheim location for the land portion of our trip.  This time we were fully aware of the tactics they would use to try and get us to attend another presentation.  The staff was very nice when giving us maps and coupons to the nearby area.  They wanted to know when we would attend our presentation.  My response was we won't be attending, we already attended one in Vegas.  Once a day when they saw us

Love the location. The room was quite. We were in the 1 bedroom. The room was clean. The only thing was the bed was very uncomfortable and hard. Not cool when your walking all day. But other then that the staff was excellent and they took care of us. I will go back again. :-)

Summary Heading: Great option for family Disney Visit
Summary: Recently visited the area to take our grandson to Disneyland for his 5th birthday. The two bedroom unit was just enough for 5 adults and 1 child. Arrival can be challenging due to limited vehicle space. Check-in was efficient. Elevators are quick. Pool was a great alternative when not at the park. Had great view of the Disney fireworks from our room "balcony". All employees top to bottom were friendly and helpful. On site garage parking also a convenient benefit. Rooftop area was closed for renovation during our visit.

Summary Heading: Super Front Staff pushes to 4 stars
Summary: We were told rooms/quality are assigned by reservation date.  Our 6 months advanced reservation date got us a third floor room next to the garbage/laundry room and crew elevator.  The hall frequently stunk of garbage.  The kitchen featured only serrated knives, the fridge plug was loose (causing it to stop once), the dishwasher was installed far from level (to load one had to hold the tray to keep it from rolling backwards). At check in one of the tub drains was very slow (maintenance response time was fast).  When our blender died they were quick to replace that too.  Overall, we had a good stay and staff saved the day.  Convenient transportation options to Disney. Really nice having 2 bathrooms on our two bedroom.

We stayed at this property for 2 nights in the 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit.  Upon arrival, check-in was a breeze and the front desk was super friendly.  We were checked in promptly and was given a quick rundown on the eateries nearby and extended us a few coupons too.  The unit was very clean and kitchen was well stocked.  In the morning, we were able to grab a donut/fruit.coffee in the lobby while waiting for our shuttle to the park. We had 6 people in our group and our unit fit everyone comfortably.  This location is very close to many restaurants and shops.  I would definitely stay here again if and when i ever decide to visit Disneyland again :)

Great place to stay, within 5 minutes from Disneyland by shuttle.  Its a nice, clean, quiet place to stay.  Was nice to unwind (in quiet) after spending hours at Disneyland.  Front desk and bellhop were super helpful.

Stayed 3 nights in a two bedroom , two bathroom unit. The facilities were clean and well kept. The service was great. The unit was modern and had a kitchen, along with a washer/dryer unit.  We had a rental car we parked for Fred in the parking garage. However, many places to eat were within walking distance. Disneyland was an easy ten minute walk. Overall we had a great experience. Would recommend staying here to families looking for more amenities then a hotel.

This place is kept up very well.  The rooms are nice, clean, updated.  Decent views, great staff.  The roof view of the Disney fireworks is fantastic.  Pool is nice as well and ample parking.  The only thing I don't care for about this place is having to wait on the elevator.  Its not as bad as it used to be (last time here was 4yrs ago), but still not great.  All in all a place well worth staying.  it's got its own resort shuttle stop too, which is handy and cheap if you don't want to take Uber or lyft.

Summary Heading: Nice Studio, But Hate The Occupancy Tax
Summary: The hotel/resort is fairly current and the grounds and lobby are very nice.  We are members of the Wyndham resorts and find the Worldmark branded resorts to be a step down in terms of amenities and furnishings, but always still comfortable and clean.  The Worldmark Anaheim is no exception.     We booked late and only a studio was available for the two nights.  I was a bit concerned that the Murphy bed would be uncomfortable, but was pleasantly surprised to find it was extremely comfortable.  The mattress was a good 12 inches thick and not too soft.  However, I would definitely recommend that you request additional pillows and a blanket as the room only had two half size pillows in the drawers and no blanket, just the sheets on the bed.  We ordered both and with these additions

I am a Wyndham owner and this was my first trip to Anaheim with family and friends.  We had a split reservation which means we stayed in a 2-bedroom deluxe for the first half of our stay and then moved into two 1-bedroom deluxe rooms for the remainder of our stay.  Each room was very comfortable, spacious and most importantly clean.  The resort is within walking distance of various restaurants, Disneyland and the Convention Center.  We only used our rental car to visit the grocery store and Universal Studios Hollywood.  Melissa checked us in upon arriving and she was a delight after spending so many hours traveling. She answered all of our questions and explained everything about the resort, Wyndham should train all of their employees to be like Melissa.  We will definitely stay

Just returned from 5 nights at Worldmark Anaheim.   Parking: Free with height limit of 7'.  Unload your luggage at the hotel entrance and then park your car.   Rooms: We stayed in the 1 bedroom and they have a king bed in the room with a queen sofa bed.   The mattress for the sofa bed needed replacement but for a child - it will do.  TVs were slightly small but good enough since we were there to enjoy the sun and Disneyland.   Kitchen had everything you need but the detergent was too mild and i found it didn't clean all that well.    There is free coffee in the lobby at 630am so go there since our coffee maker looked well used and not cleaned in the past year or so :(  Pool was large and there's a nice wading pool for kids who can't swim.  There are 2 hot tubs on the roof top

Very impressed with the attitude of the staff as if you were their only customer.  Rooms were awesome, we stayed in a 2 bedroom and a 3 bedroom.  Full kitchen well stocked, laundry in room and separate bedrooms and living area was great for family fun.  Pool is nice with bbqs poolside made for some nice family cookouts.  There are rooftop hot tubs and viewing area for Disneyland fireworks.  Vons is just a few blocks south and Disneyland is within 30 minutes or so.  CVS is a short walk

It was our third (and probably last) time staying at this very nice property, but during our recent stay, something went wrong and the entire building was out of hot water for our last 3 days.  That meant no showers, no laundry, no dishes, no swimming, etc...  Ironically, we had added a very costly extra day to our stay just so we could come home without laundry and be fresh and well rested.   That didn't really work out.  I understand that things can break, and the staff were very apologetic, but at the end of the day they did not offer any solution or compensation  - they only suggested we contact the company we booked our stay with.   So I contacted 5 Star Resorts - the company that we booked the stay with, but they said their hands are tied and there was nothing they can do.

This is the third time that we have come to this beautiful property.   The only reason that it is not excellent is that there are improvements going on and scaffolding and painting, etc.  We stayed here for a week while going to Disneyland.  We checked in very early, and they gave us the option of checking in at that time (around 11:30) or waiting for the original room that they had us which had great views.  We opted to wait for the great views.  Even though we were early, we were given a key that would allow us to park our car in the parking garage and get into the pool if we wanted to.    After parking we walked to Downtown Disney to kill a few hours until their phone call.  They did call us when our room was ready, and they called before 4:00 which is the regular check in

We stayed here in 2012 and loved the accommodations and location. The location is still great but the rooms are not as polished as they were previously. There were some areas that could have been cleaned more thoroughly. The kitchen is well stocked and staff is helpful and friendly. The pool area is very nice. The building is being repainted so there was scaffolding on parts of the building but we were not affected by it at all. Our view was not as nice during this visit but that was just a small disappointment- not a complaint. The close proximity of the parking garage and free parking is much appreciated. My only real complaint would be the water temperature. I got a semi-hot shower when I showered in the evening but anytime that we bathed or showered before noon, the water

We requested to be on the same floor as friends- they made that happen. They were remodeling the outside so the view from our balcony was scaffolding- not great, but understandable.  The staff was awesome, very nice, friendly, helpful.  The hot water was the issue. The water heater went out on Sunday and not fixed until Monday and then again on Friday the hot water "ran out" according to the staff. It was hot by the evening time.  It was the perfect walking distance to Disney (about .9 miles)...unless of course it's raining which it did on us 1 night.  The rooms while they are updated, they are small, they have very low ceilings which makes small people feel big and big people feel huge. Lol.

Summary Heading: Hotel staff needs to stop hounding visitors
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years for business, as well as for fun. This had to be about the worst stay I've experienced, and that was due to the room I ended up getting stuck with for a week.  During this trip, still for business, and still for fun, I brought my parents along with my family. My wife and I take the master bedroom, and they take the guest bedroom. My son takes the couch. Usually, rooms suites are set up so that this isn't a problem: there's usually a hallway between the Master bedroom, and the remainder of the unit. This time, however, there was no privacy between the rooms, at all.  Opening the door from the Master bedroom spit us directly out to the main room, where the boy was sleeping, where people could cook food, and directly

This place is amazing.  It is so close to the Disney parks, that you can actually watch the fireworks from your deck.  We have stayed here several times and we absolutely love it.  The rooms are cozy and well appointed.  You feel comfortably at home.   We always take the bus to Disneyland.  The bus pass is cheap and it makes it very convenient.  In fact, on this last visit, we flew in, rented a car to get us to the resort, used public transportation the entire time we were in Anaheim, and then drove our rental car back to the airport.  It would have been cheaper to take a shuttle to and from the airport.  In otherwords, if you‚Äôre there for just Disney, ride the bus.  If you plan to go to the beach, then you will definitley need a car.    By the way, very close to Cheesecake

Summary Heading: Fantastic Worldmark for Family Disney Trip
Summary: Stayed at this location for a family (adults) vacation to Disney and Universal Studios.  We've stayed at other places nearby that don't compare. The location is very nice and well maintained. Pool and hot tubs were fantastic, BBQs and amenities must be great during warm weather stays. Our room on 9th floor faced pool side and we could see Disney for fireworks at night. Distance to Disney is about 1 mile for easy walk or Uber, etc. Lots of nearby places for food and shopping. On site parking garage was secure leaving us not worried about car. Visited nearby Packing District which was fun with lots of food and drink options. Overall great place, would stay here again without hesitation.

We recently stayed here as a guest of an owner the first week in December.  We were in a 3 BR (Room 513). Even being on the 5th floor and facing the street I never heard a lot of noise.  Had no real problems. Hotel never seemed too busy, and never had to wait long for an elevator. Great restaurants are very close and within just a few minutes walk.  We did walk to the parks every day--it's about 20 minutes. Also, never had an issue with the salespeople--we stay at Bonnet Creek in FL several times a year so I'm well versed in dealing with them, and the lady wasn't pushy when I told her "no". Overall, we enjoyed this location (never used the pool--it was too chilly out) and would absolutely stay here again.

We recently stayed at this resort on our way back to Australia, it was probably one of the best places we have ever stayed, the staff we wonderful and incredibly friendly they were happy to help with any of our needs or enquiries. We had a one bedroom apartment and it was huge, the bathroom had a bath & shower, the kitchen was fully equipped with the biggest microwave I had ever seen. They even had a supply of spices for those staying longer who were cooking. Each room has a balcony & we could see Disneyland from ours. There is also a huge rooftop area with two jacuzzis that you could watch the fireworks at night or relax during the day. There were televisions in the bedroom & lounge & the couch was were comfortable. There was also a washing machine & dryer and the closets were

I enjoyed my stay at Worldmark although it could have been better. Giving free wifi for a start! We were told "first two devices are free" which I was happy with - yes the DEVICES are free but still a CONNECTION charge and an additional charge if more than two devices. Cunning. The staff were very friendly and always helpful - but we did decline their "free breakfast" as I did not have a spare two hours to sit through a sales presentation. We had a two bedroom apartment which I found to be very homely and comfortable, full kitchen, big bathrooms and everything we needed. Nice view over the pool which did get quite noisy at night. The pool area is very large - a big pool and multiple spas, with more spas on the rooftop where you can watch the Disneyland fireworks. The hotel

Summary Heading: FREE BREAKFAST = HIGH PRESSURE TIMESHARE SALES
Summary: We booked way in advance and ended up with a crappy room next to the elevators overlooking the street.  When you check in, they refer you to the "guest relations desk" to pick up your parking pass.  Then the sales tactics start.  They kindly illustrate the local restaurants and attractions, then try to sign you up for a free resort breakfast during your stay.  The breakfasts start at 8 or 10 am.  Want to visit Disneyland that opens at 9?  Forget it...  BEWARE of the high pressure timeshare sales tactics, called "a resort review" over the free breakfast offer.  RUN.  If you refuse, the threaten to charge your credit card $200 !  EVEN ANOTHER REASON TO AVOID WORLDMARK/WYNDAM RESORTS.    Who fines their members for refusing to sit through a sales presentation every time they use

Our family of 5 stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  The rooms were spacious with full kitchens. The kids had their own room allowing privacy for the adults (including two bathrooms!).  The kids loved the pool and we loved the hot tubs after long days at Disney. The roof even has 2 rooftop jacuzzis and views of Disneyland. There is free coffee in the lobby daily. There was a shuttle that took us to Disney every day (and could take you nearly everywhere touristy in Anaheim). It's also right next to the Gardenwalk mall (and Cheesecake Cafe!) for tons of restaurant opportunities. I was surprised to be offered a timeshare presentation, which I declined - but I guess that is to be expected at a timeshare type place like this. I'd still stay here again. Great place!!

The staff was amazing! We had some issues with our check-in but the customer service agent, Xuesh was so kind and helpful! He was so friendly and very helpful with everything we needed! The whole staff was so gracisous! The rooms (we room switched one night) were clean, comfortable and huge! We had our own washer dryer, kitchen and two bathrooms! I can't speak highly enough of the whole staff there! Great location, right next to Disneyland! They offer shuttle passes in the lobby as well. Can't wait to stay there again!

We stayed here with our children for 8 nights in a one bedroom unit. Unit had everything we needed. We overlooked the pool and Disneyland so we were able to watch the fireworks from our unit. We enjoyed having a full kitchen as we prepared a lot of our meals and made use of the washer and dryer which allowed us to pack 'light'. My teenage son and daughter enjoyed using the pool table in the rec room. I used the business center to 'check in' and print out our bag tags and boarding passes for our upcoming flight. Great location for visiting Disneyland. We had a car but used the Anaheim Resort Transit (shuttle) to and from Disneyland. We found that the shuttle (#8) from this location (has a stop in front of the resorts secured parking garage) is much more convenient ($5 adult, $2

We stayed at this hotel two nights in a one bedroom. The room was clean and well appointed.  The hotel is close to Dismeyland and restaurants.  The best thing though about this hotel is the amazing staff. We were greeted and taken care of beautifully by Vanessa from San Jose.  She made our stay so pleasant and was helpful throughout. The room we received looked out over the pool and had a great view of the fire works at Disneyland.   One request is that they have a little more selection of snacks, water and drinks.  We asked not to be phoned all the time for a timeshare pitch and they recognized that request. Had a great stay mostly due to Vanessa, friendly folks at concierge and the front door guys.  Bravoüéâüòä

Well appointed, spacious rooms. Cheesecake Factory on the next corner and Disneyland a 12 minutes walk. Ask for a room that faces Disney and overlooks the pools. Helpful staff and parking next door. Close to grocery stores

Went to Disneyland for Spring Break and stayed here through our time share and we loved it!  We had a 2 bedroom suite and everything was clean and very spacious!  Every one we encountered was amazing and provided excellent customer service.  We will definitely be back again!!

Great place if you're looking to stay within the vicinity of Disneyland. It's approximately a 12 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance. This hotel does not offer a shuttle but we walked to the Disneyland entrance and at the end of the day we used a Lyft/Uber to take us back (it works out to about $6.50). It is very close to restaurants located at the Garden Walk (3 minute walk) or you can cook in your suite as it is fully equipped with a kitchen and all cooking supplies.  We had a clean 2 bedroom suite for the total of 4 of us. Very spacious with 2 bathrooms. Great property without the haggle of pushy timeshare reps wanting you to attend a meeting or pressure you to buy. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars was the no free wifi. Great place to stay if you're traveling with

All the people we met at WorldMark had to have taken perky pills!  It was delightful to be greeted and helped by everyone with such a happy attitude.  The suite was very spacious, with our own little balcony in the trees.  Everything was spotless - including the parking garage. The amenities were beyond expectations.  I have a picture of my son ironing his son's shirt for the wedding.  We really enjoyed watching the Disneyland fireworks from the roof which has hot tubs. This will definitely be on our list of places to stay when we visit the area again.

I stayed one night at this location.  I had a Studio and when I entered I was expecting a bed to lay down immediately because I was dead tired.  When I entered I did not see the bed, and that got me upset.  I called the front desk and they explained to me that the bed was a hidden bed on the wall and that I had to pull it down.  I am 5 feet tall, and did not find this very nice.  I had never experienced with this beds, so I tried to figure it out.  I could not get the bed down, I called the front desk again and they told me they would send me someone.  I kept trying and trying.  They girl had told me that I did not have to move anything, just pull the bed down but it was not like that.  You had to get the cushion off the couch and then move the coffee table.   I finally figured

We are big Disney fans from the east coast and had never really made it to the west coast and Disneyland. This Wyndham/Worldmark resort really hits the mark.   The resort is among the tallest buildings in the area with great views of Disneyland and California Adventure. We watched the Disneyland fireworks, most nights, from our balcony and, on two nights, from the sundeck on top of the building. No. The music for the show wasn‚Äôt piped in, but we could still enjoy the show and even see many of the ground level affects.   Okay, the resort. Wyndham has its own floor in this Worldmark resort (the fifth) and the furnishings and touches are supposedly upgraded. This is what we have discovered as the typical Wyndham hospitality. We were greeted, by name, every evening on our return and

Summary Heading: Worldmark Anaheim (Timeshare) Reviewed by a Wyndham Owner
Summary: Great location for multi-night stay in Anaheim for Disney or Anaheim Convention Center.  Close to lots of restaurants and commerce this is a timeshare property.  So, generally, timeshare owners, or people who rent from owners end up staying here.  Not sure they make any of their product available via hotel sites.  Room sizes are much larger than average hotels.  Worldmark Anaheim offers studio (385 sq ft), 1 bedroom (700 sq ft), 2 bedroom (940 sq ft), 3 bedroom (1,305 sq ft).  All have full kitchens (except stuido).  Wyndham inventory at this location is limited to the 5th Floor only.  The rest is all Worldmark (around 220 total).  So if you are pulling a reservation out of the Wyndham Owner Reservation system, regardless of the room size, plan on your room being on that floor.

Summary Heading: Great Base for Disney, Universal Studios, and Beaches
Summary: Our family of 4 stayed in a two-bedroom unit for a week near the end of August.  We stayed for a week 6 years ago as well.  We timed it so that we arrived the day before area schools started, and Disneyland was way less crowded. We checked in on a Sunday, and immediately left to go grocery shopping.  We never visited the sales desk to get our parking pass, and you do not need a pass to park in the garage.  You only need a room key.  Sales did call us pretty much everyday, but they only reached us once and we said no thank you.  They still slipped a card for a free photo book under our door. Our unit was great!  We were on the 9th floor facing Disneyland and the best part was we were right across from the single elevator, which seems much less busy that the 2 by the pool

Summary Heading: Mostly pros, but a few cons
Summary: Great location if attending Disneyland and surrounding area. Great facility with fitness center, business center and recreation center. Large pool and 4 spas. @ on the roof are small and not hot enough but fairly private. One small one near pool was wusy jets and the large on with good heat and jets if often full of children without parental supervision and parents that bring their infants into the spa (ICK, hot water + baby = pee) Big sign says not allowed for either of these scenarios but NEVER enforced at any Worldmark resort I've ever been to. Welcoming Hosts insist this is a Non-Smoking facility but countless people standing on their balconies smoking. Why can't people respect the rules and ruin it for all of us who enjoy spending a lot of time sitting on our balcony but do

This is a time share, not a hotel.  We were guests of an owner; purchased 3 nights at a charity auction.  Our room was on the 11th floor, which minimized noise. It also provided a phenomenal view of the nightly fireworks, without being in the park.  We only ate breakfast in the room, but the coffee maker had filters provided, and there were enough dishes that we only ran the dishwasher once.  The building is a little dated, but the king bed was very comfortable.  This is not a hotel, so no shampoo or conditioner provided; the staff bailed us out.  The bathroom linens are mediocre.

Very nice resort for families. Kid friendly. The rooms are nice and spacious. Full kitchen. Washer and dryer. Roof top hot tub and observation area to watch fireworks from Disneyland. Nice pool and several hot tubs in the main area. Pleasant stay here.

We had a three night stay here paid for with Wyndham timeshare points and stayed in a 2 bed/2 bath unit. It was clean and had modern decor but not luxurious. The location is walkable to the Disney parks but is quite a distance.  We ended up calling for an Uber several times when leaving the park for the day. The staff here are very professional and friendly. The building is showing it's age and the pool deck is a mess (see photo). No pool bar and no on site restaurant. There is a small store in the lobby, but no groceries. If you want to use the kitchen in your unit, you have to drive to a store. Not a bad stay, but I would stay somewhere closer to the parks if I return.

We decided a quick get away from house renovations and drove from Arizona to spend 4 days. Greeted with great people at the front desk. Beware that if you are timeshare owner they will get you from the very start. Just stress you are not interested and they pretty much back off. Skip the breakfast, not worth it unless you want the $100. Smooth salespeople. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Lots of restaurants right around the corner and very beautiful grounds. Go to rooftop at night to enjoy the fireworks, if they have them during the stay. Quiet, though I didn't have a great view, only the parking lot.

This is a condo type hotel. Ideal for families visiting the Anaheim entertainment parks. Condos are large to accommodate larger families (we were 4 adults and 2 kids). Our condo had two bedrooms with a nice kitchen area and a living room with a pull out bed. Everything was clean and working without any problems. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. They also have a large pool with two jacuzzis and a nice workout room with aerobic machines (no weights). The rooftop from where you can see the Disney fireworks   has also two jacuzzis. No restaurants on premises but right around the corner are some. Can only recommend this hotel. The only negative was that they don't offer free WiFi (expensive plans).

We rented the 2-bed 2-bath condo at WorldMark Anaheim via vrbo. Check-in was super fast, Danielle at the front desk helped us with a smile, she then showed to go meet the rep and he would hand us the parking permit. We were busy with unloading our luggage and forgot about meeting with the rep, we went ahead and parked our car.
