The next morning the rep called and wanted to speak with us about Time Share, we declined but still went and received the Time Share info package and the parking permit. No issues! The room was clean and spacious with modern decor. The master suite has a king bed and a full bath, lots of room and storage, the TV was a bit small and oddly placed in the corner, but it's still fine, we didn't watch much TV in the bedroom anyway. The second bedroom has 2

We stay here because of the proximity to Disneyland and the surrounding area.  We like having the convenience of a full kitchen and washing machine.  The cleanliness and maintenance of the unit leaves much to be desired.  We checked-in late in the evening around 11pm which is past the designated check-in time so you would think the room is "clean & ready".    When I entered the room, it smelled like someone had sprayed something to cover up the stench of something rotten.  Rotten fish or vomit perhaps? Unfortunately, there is no sliding screen door so you can't leave the sliding door open long or gnats will get inside.   This I know from numerous previous experiences.    The refrigerator needed more cleaning.  The stovetop still had grime.  The cutting board was not cleaned and

This place was wonderful. Very nice and fully loaded rooms. The parking was great. Down the street from Disneyland and can watch the fireworks show from the rooftop, which also has a hot tub up there. Only issue was that there was not enough lounge chairs by the pool.

Summary Heading: A good place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: I had two two bedroom units when visiting with nine family members including my four grandchildren for a one week stay. The units had full kitchens and each could sleep 6 with two bedrooms and a sofa bed in the living room. Our units had a very small balcony that didn't have room for any furniture or a BBQ like many of the Worldmark units I have stayed at in the past. There is a small W/D unit in the rooms.  There is a pretty nice gift shop on premises that has ice cream available.  They also have movie rentals available.  There is a nice size pool and kiddie pool and hot tub on the ground floor. The roof has two hot tubs and a very nice deck with several lounge chairs. This is a good place to watch the Disney fireworks at night. It will get crowded so you want to get there

Good place if you have a timeshare been here couple time like that it has kitchens and washer/dryer in room. Wish the pool had a deep end but it is perfect for the kids. Plus part it's right down the road to Disneyland you can walk or take the Art shuttle.

Summary Heading: It's simply a place to stay
Summary: Room is clean but not like what we thought we were booking as shown on AirbNb.   It is walking distance to Disney (not for little ones), close to food & great access to highways.   Grocery stores are also nearby & many food establishments deliver directly to your room.

I had a 1BR appt on the top floor, with a view to the Disneyland Fireworks.  The appartment was great and roomy. I have Worldmark timeshare, so I can compare it, and there was more room in the living room that at most other places I've stayed with them. The decor was modern & clean. They had a spa & pool on the top floor which was great for a wind down after the parks.  There's a shuttle (small fee) that takes you to & from Disneyland.  For an early mlorning breakfast before the shuttles started, I walked to Disneyland. It took about 40 min to get to the restaurants, and 30 min to the park entrance.  There isn't a restaurant on site, but a number of eateries close by.  I really liked the place.

Hotel is clean, updated and well maintained.  The roof top has a observation deck with two small hot tubs for watching the Disney fireworks. We choose to walk the 0.08 miles to and from Disney each day.  Takes about 15min from the hotel to the park entrance.  Pool and hot tub area was nice. Check in parking is crazy but once you are past that plenty of parking.

Summary Heading: Great Location to Disney and Surrounding Area
Summary: This is a great location. There is a bus that takes and picks you up from Disneyland. The cost was $5 all day adult age 10 & up & $2 Children ages 3-9. It worked out perfectly for us. The staff is very nice. The studio room is tiny, but worked for us. The reort itself is nice. I love the hot tubs on the roof of the resort & we could watch the Disneyland fireworks from there. Very cool.

My friend belongs to WorldMark time share. Our room was spacious, quiet and had a balcony where we could watch the fireworks on the days we decided not to stay late at Disney. Easy access from John Wayne airport and easy access to DL by local ART bus.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights in  a 1 bedroom King suite. I've stayed in Worldmark before and every time it has been a great experience. The room was extremely clean, the King size bed was VERY comfortable, and I mean down to the pillows and comforter. We had our 3 kids sleep in the living room, they had a pull out sofa. Also there is a kitchen and balcony. It was a nice surprise that our balcony was facing perfectly to Disneyland as the first night we were able to watch the fireworks from it. There is a nice pool and jacuzzi and a fun little arcade room that the kids used.  We took the shuttle from the hotel, which was perfect as we didn't have to deal with parking or anything. I have to say the shuttle drivers were very nice and seemed to really enjoy their jobs. I highly recommend

Summary Heading: Good location, comfortable, clean and friendly!
Summary: Xesush (hope I spelled that right!) was a wonderful person to greet us when arriving at Worldmark.  He helped us checkin, and although our room was not quite ready, we were able to go and enjoy the park till close then come back and pick up our key and luggage.  The room was comfortable, quiet and clean. Sofabed was not our kids' favorite place to sleep as the mattress was not more than 2" thick but we have yet to find one that is comfortable. There were 6 of us in a 2 bedroom and it was plenty of room and enough bathroom space for 4 girls :)  The location is quite a walk from Disney area but the shuttle picks up and drops off right at the curb in front of the hotel, and you can buy $5 shuttle passes for all day at the hotel kiosk. Staff was very friendly and didn't once bother

Summary Heading: Plenty of Space and Great Location for Disneyland
Summary: I would have given a rating of 5 if they had a free shuttle to Disneyland. However the ART bus is literally right outside and they have a ticket terminal in the lobby of the hotel so it was very easy to use and the shuttles came about every 30 minutes. The pool area was lovely with plenty of loungers for everyone to relax on. The rooms had a ton of space and the bathroom was huge. With that size bathroom I would have liked to have seen a walk-in shower instead of the small tub/shower combo, but the water pressure was good. We could see the fireworks and some the World of Color Show from our balcony which was really neat. I would recommend this to any family for a convenient close to Disneyland hotel. It was also nice to be able to walk to the Anaheim Garden walk for restaurants

Summary Heading: NICE PLACE TO STAY NEAR DISNEYLAND
Summary: My wife and I recently traded into this timeshare using our Wyndham Vacations ownership.  (Since Wyndham owns Worldmark and several other timeshare brands, you can trade into this location depending on a number of things including the type of Wyndham ownership you have.)  We were told that they have one floor of rooms set aside for Wyndham owners however, this is only 20 some rooms so they hardly ever have an opening for reservations.  We stayed at this locations a few years ago and things have improved since our last visit.  The staff were all very friendly and professional.  The rooms were spacious and well-maintained.  The machine for purchasing shuttle tickets to get around Anaheim is located inside the lobby (at the back) and the staff were always ready and willing to

Great location and the shuttle service was dependable.  The unit was clean and very well appointed.  I own a timeshare with Hilton and will say that the finishes were not as luxurious as a Hilton timeshare unit but it was still comfortable.  The kitchen was big enough for a couple of people and well appointed related to appliances.  The swimming pool was great.  One of the best features is the Jacuzzi on the roof which allows you to watch the Disney fireworks while basking in a hot Jacuzzi...very nice!  My one criticism again...wifi was not free.  This makes me crazy...if airports, Starbucks and the most inexpensive motels can offer free wifi, why can't a hotel that costs upwards of $180 per night???   Did attend a timeshare presentation for Disney dollars...and the presentation

We stayed here for a few days while we took our kids to Disneyland.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit which had a full kitchen.  We loved this place.  We watched the Disney fireworks from the rooftop pool area which was very nice and relaxing.  On the weekend the elevators can get a little crazy with so many people checking in and out, but other then that we had a awesome time.

Summary Heading: Don't be tricked into a 2 hour sales pitch while you're young and get your parking pass
Summary: My parents have been a part of Worldmark for at least a decade.   This experience has tainted the whole experience of this weekend.  I feel tricked, but at the same time it is my bad. But a warning to you all! When getting your parking pass in a hurry do not let the sales people trick you into signing up for a 2 hour presentation.   If you have 2 hours to kill during your vacation they will give you $75 gift card and a breakfast. It is also never just 2 hours. You will be sold to and sold to hard.  We've done this before but we did it willingly. Just to give it a try and we received a $100 gift card. They are skimping on the gift card now and tricking you to sign. It is not JUST someone asking you about your stay or about their service. Also, it is not because you are a VIP

We stayed here for 1 night and the resort is located very close to everything you need in the area. It has a pool and it was pretty cool being in the hot tubs on the roof of the building. Apparently they have fireworks every night from Disney that can be seen which we were told about but they never went off and we were on the roof for an hour and a half waiting. The room was really big on the 5th floor (only Wyndham owner floor) and the rooms were really nice. Had an issue connecting to the wifi at first but the front desk helped us out. I'd recommend staying here, but was only here for 1 night so didn't get a big feel for the place.

We spent 5 nights at this hotel as a family. The hotel is in a great location within an easy 15 min walk to the Disney parks. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, the rooms where spacious with great views to Disneyland. The staff were great, professional and helpful, a bit too pushy in asking us to attend one of their presentations, which we were not interested in (this is a time share hotel). There are a lot of great restaurants around for all budgets. Denny's near the parks was great for breakfast or dinner on the run.  We had a car, so the complimentary parking was great as there is not much parking available on the street. The only bad part is that the Wi-Fi is not free, which in this day and age is an inconvenience.

If you have never had the privileged of being able to spend the day/night at this location, I highly recommend that you find a way or date to take the time to stay at this great, friendly, hospitable, efficient, family orientated, clean, organized location.  If you are going to be visiting Disneyland or California Adventure it is right across the street from the parks and provides a shuttle service to and from park for a round trip price of $5.00,  Plenty of Jacuzzi's and pool's for families with younger children to enjoy along with a great Roof Jacuzzi.  Roof Access allows you to enjoy the firework display from Disneyland also.

I would recommend worldmark if you ever get the chance. It's definitely nice having the kitchen and actual bedrooms. The hot tub on the roof is great for the fireworks show. The only complaint I have is the sofa beds. :/ they should go to the Murphy beds like most other worldmark locations.

Summary Heading: Great location! Super clean and friendly!
Summary: It was an amazing condo! Great amenities and staff was super friendly!!! The location is amazing and within walking distance to great restaurants! Unit was clean and provided everything we needed right down to pots and pans.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you had a wonderful vacation experience at WorldMark Anaheim. Our standard is to provide the utmost friendly staff services from our associate, such a thrill to hear they were super friendly. Happy that you enjoyed the resort room amenities and the short distance from the resort to several excellent dinning restaurants at the Garden Walk. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Great Location But Street Noise Is Horrible in Condos on Lower Floors
Summary: The location is stellar.  We had family staying at the Grand Californian at it was an easy walk.  If we didn't fee like walking we took an Uber for a cost of $5 for three people.   The unit is typical for Worldmark -- usual decor, linens etc.  Beds seem new but are very hard.    The pool area is great.  Nice pool and 2 jacuzzi's.  Plenty of seating and lounge chairs.    My biggest complaint is the noise.  We were in a unit on Floor 2 on the Katella side and the traffic noise was bad, especially in the smaller bedroom.  Woken up very early by sounds of cars and trucks, police and ambulance sirens.  Windows need to be upgraded to block out noise.  If you are a light sleeper avoid a lower floor condo at all costs.

Summary Heading: One day stay to visit Disney recommended
Summary: The resort is in Anaheim which is located very close to Disneyland and not far from Knotts Berry.  It is also close to the major highways.  Restaurants nearby are mainly chain-style.  The resort itself is fine.  The front desk staff is basically unfriendly and not helpful.  They don't like answering the front desk phone when you call from your room so numerous attempts need to be made for the staff to answer.  They also refused to make change for the vending machines, although they sell treats and merchandise at the store.  The pool is small and shaded.  We never went so I truly can not comment on the pool accommodations.  There are two small elevators with extended wait times.  The room itself was fine.  It was clean, two bedroom with two bathrooms and and pull out couch.  All

This was our 2nd stay at the Worldmark by Wyndham Anaheim. Both times for visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. The location is excellent as it is about a 1 mile walk through the Anaheim Garden Walk shopping / dining area or a 10 minute Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle ride to the park gates. The shuttle tickets are very reasonable ($12pp for 3 days). Having them meant our 17 year old and her friends could come and go on their own schedule. Which brings me to the best part of staying at the Worldmark by Wyndham condos -- my husband and I had our own bedroom and bath. Not going to get that in a standard hotel!  Having the kitchen meant the girls fixed their own breakfasts and snacks. We waited up each night in the living room while the girls closed the park. Almost as
Manager Response: We are delighted that your family returned to have another great vacation experience at WorldMark Anaheim. It is such a plus to be a short distance to the Happiest Place on Earth.  Anaheim Resort Transportation system to Disneyland it a great advantage for our guests. All of our units have kitchens which offers the opportunity to cook your meals verses going off site to find something to eat. We are extremely happy that you are thrilled with your ownership and look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: Was welcomed from the start. Helpful staff. Immaculate apartment. Great service. Walking distance to everything. Loved the rooftop spa for the nightly fireworks. Fully equipped apartment with everything you need to self cater. Will return there again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel in the perfect location
Summary: Have timeshare with Wyndham. Wasn't sure what to expect but was blown away by the location, cleanliness and space of the apartment. It's very close to good eateries, 7/11 and Disneyland! Shuttle departs from the resort every 20mins for Disneyland which is cool. I'm glad I chose this resort for my short stay in Anaheim.

We traveled to this property for a multi-day visit to Disneyland. We had a 1 bedroom w/ children sleeping on the floor and on the sofa sleeper (pulled the mattress to the floor). Like all WorldMark properties, the facility was very clean, and true to their proximity to Disneyland, the staff was incredibly friendly and responsive.  Pools, hot tubs (even on the roof) are great. The view of the Disneyland fireworks from the roof is nice for families w/ younger kids.  The property is aging, but it is still acceptable -- you will discover charges for the extras, thinner towels and mattresses that have seen better days. WiFi will cost you, unless you sweet talk the timeshare folks who may give it to you as part of the timeshare up-sell package. We had a bad experience w/ the timeshare

This place is getting dated and the timeshare selling is out of hand. Everything is around trying to get you to buy more points. The place makes it really hard to relax and enjoy your time there. Elevators are slow, pools are crowded and the roof is very busy during the fireworks.

Great location for a visit to DisneyLand and California Adventure, within walking distance but there is a shuttle stop located right outside the hotel with a $5.00 fee for all day use. THIS IS A TIMESHARE property so its a little tricky to politely say no to there hard sell tactics but if you can get past that the place is great! LARGE bedrooms (we stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo) with full kitchen. The place was immaculately clean and well maintained. Fully stocked with anything you could need except food.Disneyland foreworks viewing from the roof top is really cool! It is across the street from a kind of shady motel where we saw a 7 car police raid with them chasing a man with guns drawn, luckily he was smart enough to surrender and no one was hurt. Keep this in mind when

My sister is a worldmark member and this is a great place to stay when visiting Disneyland. The rooms are well appointed and clean, there are lots of insight perks, pool, hot tub, roof hot tubs and fireworks watching, gym, rec room, and only a shirt 15 minute walk to Disneyland or the ART bus stops right outside.

We were guests of my daughter at this property.  She had a two bedroom suite and we were in a studio.  The room was very nice.  It had a Murphy bed that was quite comfortable. The bathroom was huge.  Everything was really clean.  We visited there room and it was large.  They were sleeping 4 adults, a toddler and a one year old.  It worked very well.  We had a great time.

On the way to Canada we decided to stay 5 nights in LA on the way through. We chose Worldmark mainly because of its proximity to Disneyland - we had a two day pass and wanted to get the most out of our time there. Worldmark really was the perfect location for Disney visitors. It is about a 20 minute walk to the park or there is a shuttle that costs about $5USD that stops just outside the entrance. We stayed in a two bedroom unit with 2 bathrooms. It was spacious with a modern TV in the living room. The unit would have easily accommodated 6 people. It was clean, large and well appointed - the bathrooms were spacious and they both had a bathtub/shower. Beds were large and comfortable. We were staying on the 7th floor and had a view into a vacant lot, but it didn't really matter

Summary Heading: First Disney Trip for our Kiddo
Summary: This was the fourth Worldmark hotel we have stayed at, and the Anaheim location did not disappoint. Our 2 bedroom w/ kitchen suite was on the north side of the building, so we could see the fireworks from Disneyland each evening, without having to leave the room. This location also has a bigger pool area, as well as an arcade/video game room with a pool table (located on the first floor.) If you are spending money on a full Disney vacation, you have likely rented a car to travel outside of the city, however; opt for the Disney shuttle-bus (which stops right in front of the hotel) each morning, and delivers you to the park's main gate entrance. Overall, this is a very clean and well kept facility with friendly and helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Close enough you can see the Disney fireworks
Summary: It's our second time at the Worldmark Anaheim in our own self contained unit. The staff are friendly and the facilities are clean & tidy.  We saw the Disney fireworks each night from our room and you can also access the roof at 9pm to watch them. A close walk to Disney and the hotel offers free & secure parking. If you are there just for Disneyland then you won't need to hire a car as the restaurants are also close by. The wifi costs but only if you have an American credit card so we were provided it for free! We would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling with family to visit Disneyland.

We used Super Shuttle for a round trip ride between the timeshare and Santa Ana Airport for a cost of $20 per person. Getting to the Worldmark Anaheim took a long while as it was a shared ride and other passengers were going to their respective homes. Along with the heavy traffic and a couple of accidents on the freeway we finally reached our destination almost 45 minutes later. But four days later going back to SNA direct took only 15 minutes as it was on a Sunday at 8 am! We used our Wyndham points to book a two bedroom unit for three nights. That placed us on their 5th floor for Wyndham owners/guests. We were the only ones to receive the complementary soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and mouthwash, not available to Worldmark guests on the other floors. Check in was

Great facility that still has that "New" feeling. Very clean and well maintained. Close to D-land and lots of variety in dinning. Only Negative is that as large as it is ...there is a minimum of elevators. In the Morning or during high activity times, you can end up waiting quit a while for the lift.

We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath unit.  It was very clean and spacious.  Our check in was quick and easy.  Close enough to walk to Disney.  Lots of restaurants and shopping close by.  Loved the free and secure parking.

Summary Heading: Complete set up, walkable to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in a 1 bedroom and 2 bedroom rooms. The location was very good, they let us park there even after check out to go to Disneyland during the day before we left. Disneyland is probably a 10-15 minute walk. The 2 rooms themselves were clean, had a kitchen, lots of space to accommodate a large family (8 + 1 baby). All in all this was a nice place but there are a few nickel and dime schemes going on ($4 DVD rental, multi day Wi-Fi options with fee, complimentary breakfast only complimentary with multi-hour presentation). The $5 shuttle/day was actually a good deal though we didn't use it.   One thing I noticed were the limited elevators, there are 2 off the main lobby and one that is tucked away in a corner of the hotel near the stairs. Was usually always a line to use the

We checked into a 3 bedroom for 1 night.  The unit was very spacious and spread out.  Very accommodating to our needs and clean.  There were two drawbacks though, the first which is the most important to me was the check in experience.  Two ladies were at the counter, one was helping someone and the other wasn't, I assume she was finishing up something.  She looked up and said she would be with me soon, she leaves and doesn't return.  5-8 minutes passes and someone else finally comes up to the counter and calls me over.    I already knew the drill about how your room key that you get from the front desk gets you into the parking garage but you have to go over to the sales desk to get your "parking permit" which is highly annoying.  They are just trying to get you to come and buy

Disneyland Trip, this was out convenient home base.  Kid got sick from too much junk food and we liked that we could wash his clothes and shoes.  We were at end of hall close to garbage and elevators and never noticed. Employees helpful and we listened to sales presentation and turned down offer to buy.  They did not pester us and were very nice the rest of our stay.
Manager Response: So pleased to hear that your room at the resort was like your home away from home. It is always a pleasure to know that our staff goes above and beyond to be helpful with our guest needs.

Summary: Great rooms, staff, and location.  $5 shuttle tickets good for three days from WM to Disney. Walkable, also.  Can watch fireworks from rooftop if too tired to stay,  Short bus ride back if you want to leave park and return for lunch.
Manager Response: So delighted to see you enjoyed your vacation stay in so many areas of the resort amenities. Friendly staff, Anaheim Resort Transportation shuttle service to Disney for a low cost and enjoying the fireworks on the resort roof top. The shuttle service to Disney is extremely convenient from the distance to the resort to return to enjoy meals in your room. We look forward to you coming and visiting us again soon!

Summary Heading: BED BUG EXPOSURE AT WORLDMARK ANAHEIM
Summary: We stayed at this hotel from September 27 to October 3, 2015 and our room was infested with bed bugs.  Don't stay at this hotel under any circumstances.  I can't tell you what a problem bed bugs cause!!

Really, we have stayed here before about 2 years ago and it was fantastic.  We booked  in plenty of time to get a really good room--one that we could see the fireworks from.  We arrived early and we did not expect to get a room right then; but we asked the person behind the counter if they could please call us as soon as there was something available.  They told us absolutely.  Not a problem!  Expect a call with in a couple of hours and they'd get us settled right in.  My husband and I took our family to Downtown Disney to spend about...oh...6 hours there without receiving a phone call.  It was finally way after check in time that we decided to go back and see what was going on.  We arrived to the lobby very busy and lots of people checking in.  I patiently waited my turn and

We found the Worldmark Anaheim to be very clean and roomy. Good easy walk to Disneyland. Parking our hire car ( a huge 15seater van) was easy and free. Wifi was quick.  The only thing I would have liked was a room on the other side with a better view and a kettle in my room as I am a tea drinker. We were not pestered at all about joining a Wyndham timeshare presentation. Loved our stay here and would definitely return and recommend.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you enjoyed your family holiday and had an awesome vacation experience at WorldMark Anaheim.  Delighted that you enjoyed the easy walk to Disneyland from the resort. The Anaheim Resort Transportation Bus also provides transportation at a minimal cost that will take you to Disneyland. It picks up outside the front of the resort approximately 3 times per hours. The bus schedule times are at the top of the hour, 20 minutes after and 20 minutes prior to the new hour. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Wonderful place to stay if you can get in.  When you are directed to the desk to get your "parking pass"  that is code speak for getting you signed of for a "owners update" or timeshare presentation.  They will offer you $75.00.  Hold out for more.  I just got them up to $125.00 but have in the past held out for $175.00 and gotten it.  If they don't give it to you right away, then say you will think about it and if they end up with open spots to call you for the amount you want.

The resort is very close to Disneyland, the staff is very nice, the room was very clean. My kids loved the pool.. you can also look at the fire works every night from the hotel (disneyland). It has a parking garage and a tourist tram picks up, right outside the hotel

Pro's: --> Mattress is good/very comfortable (king) --> Large enough in size (stayed in 2 bedroom), but it has a really small stack-able washer/dryer. --> Great location to key attractions (i.e. Disneyland...around corner of Toy Story parking lot & Knotts Berry Farm) --> Relatively new-ish building for a timeshare property (usually they are old and not very desirable) --> Unit is clean  (lobby is not kept as clean throughout day...only in AM) --> Gated parking garage.    Con's: --> If you are a Wyndham owner, you only get to stay on the 5th floor = 21 units in total.  Yes, you can try to do the Worldmark exchange process and pay the extra fee.  But, why?  Not worth it in my humble opinion. --> Lights -- the bulbs seem to be ~40 watts (or whatever the CFL equivalent).  In fact

We were only staying here one night on the way to SD.  We wish we could have stayed longer because it was really nice.  Right when you walk in the room seemed cool and clean.  We had a view of the pool.  I loved having a bedroom for traveling with our baby.  The bathroom was big and nice.  The tub drained REALLY slow though.  I think that is typical of most hotels, though.    The pool was awesome.  It had a little kiddie pool that was only a foot deep that was perfect for my 15 month old.  The pool was big and it had a big hot tub.    The kitchen was nice and open; it had everything we needed.  We had just stayed at a Wyndham with dirty carpets so we were relieved when these were clean and free from stains.  Parking was free in the parking garage which was nice.  I liked the

(July 2015) Two couples in a 2 bedroom suite. Stayed 3 nights. Staff was helpful in accommodating bridging 2 twins into a single bed, as a king/queen suite was not available. Staff very nice. Limited food access inside hotel, but close proximity to the Anaheim Garden Walk, which has multiple eateries and coffee/pasty locations, and expanding.  Shuttles available to DIsney, or can be a manageable walk. From rooftop, can see Disney Fireworks display in distance, Large pool and spa areas, which we did not use during our visit. Request higher floor room, directed towards Disney for better views and less road noise. Full kitchens available with basic cooking availability. BBQ on site as well by pool  Rooms are pretty standardly equipped and decorated as a good hotel. Less upgrades

Summary Heading: Good rooms for family of four
Summary: This place is about a mile away from Disney which for us was probably a bit too far. However, if you can deal w/the distance, the rooms, at least the two bedroom one we stayed in, are ideal for a family of four. I only give it a '3' for the following:  * The fire alarm went off about 1 am our first night there after a long day a Disney. It turned out to be a false alarm. Apparently someone was smoking in their room. Staff didn't seem to be too concerned or apologetic.  * The elevators are painfully slow and were an average 3-5 min wait * I get that this isn't a hotel, but a least have a continental breakfast. When I ask about breakfast options, don't tell me there's a 7-11 down the street or I can sit through the sales seminar * In order to get your parking pass, you have to

Summary Heading: Very Nice and Had Everything We Needed
Summary: We were very happy with our stay.  The hotel is very clean, very well decorated, and surprisingly quiet considering its proximity to the parks.  The unit had everything we needed, and included a welcome pack of coffee, popcorn, and lemonade.  We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit with washer/dryer,  kitchen, living room, and dining area.  The rooms were large and comfortable, and the living room had a small balcony overlooking the pool.  It had 3 flat screen TVs, and very comfortable beds and linens.  The front desk and concierge staff was very friendly and helpful.  The pool was medium size, but very nice.  Pool towels were large and plentiful.  There were lounge chairs, covered eating areas, and BBQ.  It has a kiddie pool and two hot tubs.  There were 2 additional hot tubs on

We got a crappy room overlooking a business and street but was ok.  No deck and no screens in the windows in our room.  Really crappy not having a deck. Pool is nice and there are 4 bbqs by the pool that you can bbq on. Front staff desk (Cecile) very rude and nasty. Bellboy fell all over himself apolgizing for her behaviour. We booked back in Jan here and wanted pool view. Nope and not willing to work with us.  Free coffee and tea by the pool. Wifi is $16 for 10 days.  No option for 7.

We have stayed at this Worldmark property several times and it is an excellent location to Disney, right on the ART line and the last stop before Disney.  The rooms are good sized and clean, a good, basic pool for the breaks at Disney. My only complaint about this location is he pushy sales people.  We declined all sales pitches for 20 minutes before we could receive our parking pass, and wouldn't take no for answer and continued to call and ask daily.  Without the pushy sales dept. I love this place, but it is a turn off every time you walk  in the lobby, but you can't beat the location to Disney!

I stay at this timeshare resort any time I  visit Anaheim. It is a little bit of a walk to the Convention Center and DL but it is doable. There is a trolley that picks up at this location to the theme parks which is very convenient. It's located right next to
Manager Response: We are please that enjoyed the location of the resort to Disney Land and the Convention Center. The Anaheim Resort Transportation system to and from the park/area is truly convenient to our guests.

Summary: Been traveling with Wyndham for years, and I almost always disappointed with resorts compared to what they advertise.  Long Wharf in Newport and Bonnet Creek are great locations, most others disappoint me.   But this place truly surprised me.  Check in was professional and smooth (only had to fight a little for my parking pass). The suites were modern and renovated. The pool on the ground floor had two hot tubs and wonderful places to hang out. The pool deck on the tip floor was well done and great for watching the fireworks at Disneyland. Parking was easy in and easy out.   They managed to create an oasis in the middle of urban messiness.    Next door is a great mall area that looks great and offers a nice range of restaurants (PF Changs, Roys, CPK etc...)   I truly loved my
Manager Response: We are delighted that you were truly surprised by the WorldMark Anaheim resort.  Thrilled that you enjoyed the renovation of the unit and your check in experience was smooth and professional.  The Garden Walk Mall next door is a plus for our resort with a short easy walk to a wide range of great restaurants, shops and Movie Theater. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Wonderful accommodation close enough to Disneyland. The apartments were very spacious and modern and the pool and games area were fantastic, also a great view of the fireworks from the rooftop. Easy access to Disneyland by walking or using the shuttle to save tired little feet, shuttle stop right outside the front door. This Worldmark had everything we needed and more, the only downside was that the Worldmark sales staff were very pushy and insistent, however they offer some good incentives to attend their briefings.

I had planned a last minute trip to Disneyland since some friends had invited me to tag along on their first trip. Not wanting to intrude on the hotel room they had already booked at another resort, I got in touch with some family that is part of the Wyndham Vacations club thing and was able to secure a studio room at this resort.  The room was very well maintained and taken care of. Everyone on the staff that I encountered were fantastic. Having travelled from the east coast early in the morning, the time difference gets me there way before the designated check-in time. I took my exhausted self to breakfast at a local IHOP but when I got back, the girl I had pre-registered with was nice enough to point me to the game room and offered to walk over and wake me up when my room was

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but not as close to Disneyland as advertised
Summary: The resort is not within 'easy' walking distance to Disneyland, especially if you have small children - so that was disappointing. Another issue was with the 'Sales (Timeshare) Presentation' - sales staff had a hard time taking "No" for an answer - and that was just to decline attending. I don't mind a hard sell, but eventually they need to concede and respect you as a guest at their facility. Otherwise, room/property was very nice, safe and well maintained.

We stayed a week here at the WorldMark in Anaheim.  The location can't be beat, we could walk to Disney, great shopping and restaurants.  The room was a spacious two bedroom with a full kitchen, laundry and a nice size living space.  The only thing i didn't enjoy was no room cleaning service, but we didn't spend much time in the room so it was easy to keep up.  The dishwasher wasn't working and when we called the front desk we had a repair person up in minutes.  The next day it didn't work again and when we returned from Disney it had been replaced. The pools where great and the roof top hot tubs where fun.  We also had a great view of the fire works from Disney from the roof which was great on nights we didn't want to stay at Disney late. I would definitely recommend this hotel

Good roomy place. nice d√©cor. need to drive or take the ART shuttle to Disneyland, but the ART shuttle sometimes is not reliable. not walking distance to Disneyland. have gym and recreational room. Can see firework from the room and the roof.

Very good experience! The staff were very helpful and very nice and always available when needed. The room was clean and comfortable. If we needed fresh towels are or new sheets, all we had to do was make a phone call and the were quickly delivered to our door. The location was close enough to walk to Disney, but far enough away from the hustle and bustle surrounding Disney. Several restaurants were very close and the hotel provided a list of restaurants that delivered. My only complaint was the water pressure and the height of the shower head made it difficult for my short 5 year old to take a shower.

The location of the Hotel is peaceful close to Disneyland. We stayed in an one bedroom apartment which was good in size. The toilet was very spacious and sparkling clean. The view from the balcony was amazing . They have a sofa cum bed in the living room which can be utilized for sleeping. Swimming pool seemed nice but it was too col to swim.

We arrived at 4:20,after driving for 6 hours, to be told our room was not ready. The check in person suggested we put our stuff in their storage and go dinner. We decided to wait in the lobby. After 30 minutes I again asked about our room which needed another 30 minutes. At this point we were tired and demanded a room since check in is 4 pm and it was now after 5. We then had to go to another desk to get the car tag where they try to get u to sign up for a tour and talk on the property. When we finally got to our room we noted 3 other rooms on the floor being cleaned for waiting guests. Maybe they need to splurge on more housekeepers. Then we discovered Internet has a charge of $15.00 for a week for 2 devices.   The rooms are well maintained and the area is nice but I don't

Summary Heading: The Hotel was nice but prepare to be hounded if you turn down the time share presentation
Summary: Stayed at the property last week with some friends that have a time share there.  The room was decent aside from the strange smell in the room that took about a day to get out.  There was a lot of room for the 4 of us but the kids mentioned the pull out bed was very uncomfortable and my Son said the bar was in his back all night.  The staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful which is more than I can say about the people at the time share desk.  They will be your best friend when signing you up for a tour and presentation.  I have never been interested in a time share, we like to try many different places. We went ahead and said "yes" to the tour honestly for the $100.00 American Express card and that's it.  Plus it was early enough we could do it before we left for the

We stayed at WorldMark Anaheim to visit Disneyland.  First day we walked, which took us about 20-30 minutes through the GardenWalk. I'm a Wyndham Owner using points to book and stayed on the 5th floor.  We went to the roof at night to watch fireworks at Disneyland.  We had a nice 2 bedroom 2 bath unit.  Everything was clean and well stocked.  We were allowed to park 2 cars. There's a hotel tax which you had to pay upon check-in.  Elevators were a bit slow, so you had to be patient.  We will definitely be back next time we need a Disney fix!

Summary Heading: One-Bedroom Stay Excellent for Disney and Convention Center
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the WorldMark in April, 2015 with my adult brother and teenage nephew.  During our stay, we had easy walking access to both the Anaheim Convention Center and the Disneyland Resort.  The four of us stayed in a 1-bedroom suite, which has a master bedroom, full kitchen, one bathroom, and living room with a pull-out couch for a secondary bed.   There are several outlets throughout the suite, all of which are the North American plug configuration, 110v.  There is a washer and dryer in the suite, and two loads of detergent were supplied.  In the kitchen, there is a dishwasher, for which two loads of detergent were also provided.  The kitchen came equipped with a variety of dishes, though I confess we did not make use of any of them during our stay, so I
Manager Response: We are delighted that you and your husband had an amazing vacation experience at WorldMark Anaheim.  Delighted that you enjoyed all the unit amenities in your room and the every employee your encounter during your stay was friendly and pleasant. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Enjoyed our first stay here. We walked to Disneyland each time. There is a shuttle service $, but we like the exercise! Love the rooftop view of fireworks and the hot tubs. Friendly staff and helpful too. The Convention Center and Angels stadium are close by also. We took in a Dodgers game during our stay too.

Resort is  very clean, everything you need for family stay. Lovely rooms, good size. Staff very helpful especially suman. Had a wonderful stay. Loved the fresh donuts and free coffee. Nice rooms and good location.

We have stayed at this Anaheim property over the years.  Lately, each visit has had some issues with cleanliness and maintenance.  There are inconsistencies in the maintenance and cleanliness of the units.  This particular visit warranted a review and was a gross disappointment  Kitchen counters had grime on them and the inside cabinets needed to wiped down.  The inside of the refrigerator had stains and the freezer smelled so bad we had to leave it open to let the smell of bad rotting fish out before putting our ice cream in there.  Luckily, we had ice packs with us to keep the ice cream from melting.  The oven racks were covered with some grime and the pizza pan was tarnished and stained.  There were no pot holders and the kitchen utensils have been excessively used.    One
Manager Response: We continue to work with the housekeeping and maintenance staff to improve the cleanliness/working order of our units. The expectation is to have all our units in excellent condition for our guest enjoyment.  We look forward to your return to the Anaheim property in the future and giving us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional vacation experience.

Summary: My partner and I have stayed in numerous locations with our time share throughout the years but the experience I had this past visit was the ultimate.  My last minute vacation started a lil crazy. I wanted to have some mother daughter bonding and decided on a road trip to Anaheim.  I had booked a room elsewhere which didn't work out and WM was full to my disappointment.  I ended up staying close to the resort hoping for a cancelation.  My partner called a few times until finally the gentleman on the phone came across a room which we booked right away. I only stayed for a night but it was great. Once I came in to the lobby a young lady from the timeshare counter approached me and asked me if I needed some coffee which by then I was in desperate need of caffeine.  The staff was
Manager Response: So delighted that your overnight trip was so wonderful! Our standard is to provide the utmost friendly staff services from our associate, such a thrill to hear they went above and beyond. Excited that your will be returning to the Anaheim resort in the near future for your next vacation experience.

Summary Heading: Good family location for Disney etc.
Summary: Our family of four just finished a six day stay. The location is a 10 minute walk to the main gates at Disneyland. It was very convenient for us to travel throughout Southern California during her stay. The two bedroom units were outstanding for us and our two kids.  We booked our vacation on VRBO.com so we declined the timeshare pitch on our arrival which didn't go over well with the staff. They tried numerous times to get us to attend but we continue to say no.  It was a shame because the remainder of the staff were very friendly and courteous during our entire stay. A few things you need to know if considering stay here‚Ä¶ First, there is no maid service unless you stay for eight days or longer.  Each unit does come with a washer and dryer so you will need to wash your own

Summary Heading: Clean resort cloe to Disneyland parks
Summary: We spent 3 nights here in a large 1 bedroom. Well-run resort; friendly and helpful staff. Disney shuttle stops at the corner, so made a visit to the parks easy. Hertz and Enterprise rental car company offices and restaurants within a two block walk.  It has a large rooftop area with hot tubs and lounge chairs which was great for watching the Disney fireworks.
Manager Response: We are pleased that you had a wonderful vacation experience at Anaheim. Glad that you enjoyed your spacious one bedroom unit and the roof top spas with the excellent view of the Disneyland fireworks. The Garden Walk mall is extremely convenient for many choices of restaurant dining. We look forward to your return on your next vacation experience.

Summary: The Worldmark at Anaheim was a very nice resort. Flat Screen TV's were in both the living room and the bedroom in our 1 Bedroom Condo. King Bed in the master and a Pull Out Sofa in the living room. In room laundry and full kitchen were also large assets. Would be approx. 15-20 minute walk to the Entry Plaza of Disneyland/California Adventure depending on how fast you walked, also depending on how big your family is you might want to utilize ART (Anaheim Resort Transit). The resort is about 2 minute walk to all the Dining/Shops at Gardenwalk which includes Bubba Gumps/California Pizza Kitchen and Cheesecake Factory. There is also a 7-11 right across the street that is good for some small odds/ends after a long day at the parks. Parking was "included" in the stay and had gated

I usually stay down in Anaheim when I come down on a Saturday night. This resort was open so I booked a room so I could say I stayed here. Man the room is amazing! I will defiantly be staying here again when there is time available. Love being a Worldmark owner!
Manager Response: We are ecstatic that WorldMark Anaheim is one your favorite resorts. The closeness to Disneyland and the Anaheim Resort Transportation system to and from the park is extremely convenient to our guests. The enjoyment of the fireworks from the units is an extra plus, delighted that you had the benefit of the view.

Summary: This is one of my favorite Worldmark hotels and it is super convenient for visiting Disneyland. I do wish they had more buses going to/from Disneyland and the hotels, but that isn't the hotels fault since that is a city run item. We used a two bedroom room and it was perfect for my parents, my spouse, our two kids and I to go. Plus we could see the fireworks from our hotel room which the kids loved. Not a fan of the tiny balcony, but we just didn't open the door.
Manager Response: We are elated that WorldMark Anaheim is one of your favorite resorts. The Anaheim Transportation Bus that takes you to Disneyland picks up outside the front of the resort approximately 3 times per hour. The bus schedule times are at the top of the hour, 20 minutes after and 20 minutes prior to the new hour. Delighted that you enjoyed the fireworks from Disneyland Park.

Summary: At a Worldmark owner, this is one of my favorite resorts. It's convenient to Disney and since my parents were traveling with us having the bus stop right at the resort was nice. This is the second time we have stayed here and we have seen some improvements and updates in the bedding. Yes, the pool was under construction but it said that it would be when I booked the weekend. The elevator was not an issue and I like that the parking is free. Yes, this time I attended an owner update which always last longer than they say. But that is the  case with most timeshares which is why I only schedule them I the day we plan on checking out. Will stay here again.

4 stars for the room and amenities. Wi-fi extra? No thanks. Also, no maid services during your stay. We would've enjoyed not having to make our beds in the morning. I enjoyed having the kitchen, but only for the food we got through delivery. Who wants to cook on vacation?? The rooftop hot tubs are great and you can see the fireworks. The pool is closed for renovation, but there is a hot tub down there as well. On what became our last night at the resort, we found a shuffleboard setup, out past the pool. If it weren't so dark or late, we would've played. There's a nice gym and a nice arcade with games, ping-pong, pool, and air hockey. The location of the resort is strange. If you walk out onto the street and take a right, you are headed to the Anaheim Gardenwalk, which is just a
Manager Response: We are pleased that you enjoyed the gym and recreation room which offers games, ping pong and pool tables.  The resort pool area is currently under renovation, the area will re open mid February. We are an ownership resort and daily room service is not one an available amenity but we offer towel and linen exchanges upon request during your stay.

Summary: Parking is free, the front desk messed up our booking but was able to fix it within a few minutes, always was clean. People at the desk were always nice and willing to help whenever we had any questions. The hotel was quiet, and close walking distance to Disneyland. Great quality for the price, as has the full kitchen which is nice to make own meals. Only downside was no free wifi.

Great hotel.  Great rooms.  Great location - about 2 blocks away from Disneyland!  Close to walking/outdoor malls, restaurants, etc.  We loved the location.  Loved that we had a full kitchen and could make our own meals (and save money!) Only thing I don't like about Worldmark is that they try to get you to attend their "presentations" every time upon check-in.  Just give us our parking pass and let us get settled in our rooms.  Then follow-up and see if we are interested in a presentation. Only dissatisfaction this time is that when we tried to check in, the room wasn't ready.  I thought check in was 3.  Come to find out it is 4.  So, we went and did some grocery shopping and came back at 4.  Room still wasn't ready until 4:30.  Minor hiccup!  They did accomodate by giving us a

this hotel also know as the Wyndham Anaheim is well position with comfort rooms with great facilities, dish washer, sink cook top etc. spacious rooms and comfortable beds.  Location wise it is only one block from Disneyland and if you get a room on the 5th floor and a above facing Disneyland you can see the firework from the comfort of you lounge chair :).  Even though this is a timeshare property don't let this stop you from staying in this well present property.

Summary Heading: Great accommodations near the Happiest Place on Earth
Summary: This location is ideal for any family looking for great accommodations in Anaheim. Units have full kitchen, so you can cook and eat, just like home. Also has full laundry in the units. Pool, hot tub and gymnasium are great physical fitness amenities. Outdoor BBQ to cook up your favorite steaks and ribs. Highly recommended destination.
Manager Response: We are delighted that your family had a great vacation experience at WorldMark Anaheim, next to the Happiest Place on Earth.  Delighted that you enjoyed the BBQ area by the pool. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: This was a very well laid out room with a full kitchen.  The staff was some of the nicest and most attentive I've experienced.  Our heater/A/C went out and they came up at 10pm with a crew to speed up the fix so baby could get to bed and got it fixed for us.  The parking is free and garage, which is very good near Disney.    You could walk to many restaurants and attractions, too.  The location is pretty amazing.  Best shower I've had in years!  There is a tub and separate stand-up shower and the shower had such amazing, strong, full spray, I was in heaven.  The usual things I don't like about Worldmark - no shampoo or cream rinse or lotion and no free Wi-Fi.  The usual things I love about Worldmark - amazing pillows and nice large room.

Summary Heading: Such an awesome place to relax after a long day at the parks.
Summary: This was a great week long  stay for us and our family. It was so nice to have a place to relax and just enjoy the evenings. The hot tubs on the roof were awesome to watch fireworks from Disneyland. The beds were a little firm for our taste, but they were nice beds. The walk was a little long at the end of the day from the parks back to the hotel. We would love to stay here again.
Manager Response: We are delighted that your family had an awesome vacation experience at WorldMark Anaheim.  Delighted that you enjoyed the roof top hot tubs including the view to watch the fireworks from Disneyland.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Great proximity to Disneyland. Resort was about a 20 minute walk to the Disney parks and a bit longer walk home. There were 3 spots with elevators and we usually didn't have long to wait to get the one nearest our room. There is a media center off the lobby where you are able to use the computers to check in and print out your boarding passes for your flight home. We didn't use the pool, but it never seemed overly busy that we saw. We saw the pool deck being hosed down a couple times and I think it may have been done daily. The staff were friendly.

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly staff, housekeeping meh
Summary: We are not Wyndham owners but do own HGVC...stayed here a couple of nights as guests of friends.  We stayed here in 2010 as well.  The staff is very friendly.  You are offered a free American breakfast if you will take an hour tour of the property...they also include $100 for your time.  We declined.    Our two bedroom was ok.  The furnishings are a little cheap, beds weren't the softest, no double sink in master, etc.   Nothing too major since we were just using this as a crash pad after our long days at Disney.  Housekeeping was a different story.  Our toilet was stopped up on arrival, the bathroom was "hairy" which I can't take.  A ball of hair was on the floor of the master bath when we walked in.  The first morning I showered, there was two strange hairs in the shower.
Manager Response: We continue to work with the housekeeping staff to improve the cleanliness of our units. The expectation is to have all our units in excellent fresh condition for our guest enjoyment.  We look forward to your return to the Anaheim property in the future and giving us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional vacation experience.

Summary: The WorldMark Anaheim is about a 20 minute walk from the opening gate of Disney and Disney California Adventure. Day passes on the transpiration buses can be purchased for $5.  If you want a free breakfast to get one free ticket to Disneyland for one day ($96 value) and a $25 dollar American Express card, you can sit though a time share presentation.  They will attempt to sign you up for the presentation where you pick up your free car parking sign. (WorldMark Anaheim is a jointly owned World Mark and Wyndham Resorts and if you decide to become a member, Wyndham is the better option over WorldMark - overall higher quality properties in more locations.) The Wyndham floor is fifth floor. The rooms are apartment sized - so you can prepare any and all meals that you need to, though
Manager Response: We are pleased that you had a wonderful vacation experience at Anaheim. Glad that you enjoyed the roof top spas and the excellent view of the Disneyland fire works. The Garden Walk mall is just a short distance from the resort offer several excellent dinning experiences and well as a splendid Movie Theater.

Summary: Went in October for my bday. The room was mostly clean and it was quiet. We did find the remnants of the beer drinking from the previous occupants. It was a walkable distance to Disneyland and also offered a bus stop right outside the front entrance. We took the bus the first day in the park and landed up waiting for 40 minutes for the bus to show up at the end of the night. We decided it was faster to walk the second day. They offer a small kitchen for cooking we didn't have enough time to enjoy any of the other amenities. Overall the experience was pleasant. We will return at some point.

After the horrid mess that is San Diego Mission Valley we were so pleased when we arrived here early today.  Even though our room was not ready so early we were made to feel welcome by not only the front desk but by the host.  There was no pressure to upsell us new points, they gave us great maps, discount coupons and directions in a pleasant manner.  Our room is so nice, beautiful furnishings, clean clean clean.  High definition television stations, guide to where the stations are, both were missing in San Diego.  The amenities like the pool and rec. room are fabulous.  We love this resort!  Right outside is the ART shuttle to the parks, so convenient. Well done.  San Diego Mission Valley could learn everything from Anaheim!
Manager Response: We are delighted that you had a wonderful vacation experience at WorldMark Anaheim. Happy that you enjoyed the resort room amenities and Anaheim Resort Transportation shuttle to Disneyland, it is a plus for our resort. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Home away from away with Disneyland just down the street!
Summary: We stayed in a two bedroom to sleep 6 people.  We have two young children under the age of 5.  We walked to Disneyland everyday and walked back in the evening.  It is about a 10-15 minute walk.  CVS pharmacy is just down the street with plenty of restaurants near by if you do not want to cook in your room.  Amazing views of the fireworks at night from the roof top.  The pool does not get much sunlight during the morning or early afternoon.  Our children still enjoyed the pool and there is a large hot tub located next to the pool.  You are able to suntan on the roof.   I would recommend staying at this Worldmark resort instead of Dolphins Cove.

Summary Heading: Decent room, but hard sales tactics
Summary: My family was lied to in order to purchase a time share over a year ago. We were recently able to use the points we had purchased, for a change, and stayed at the Worldmark Anaheim location.   The room was decent. Having a washer and dryer inside the room was a nice thing. The bathroom was spacious, and having multiple rooms was good, too, since my son is getting a bit too old to be sharing a room with mom and dad. The kitchen was helpful, in order to save money in the Anaheim area, as we were able to make breakfast there, rather than eat out for every meal. The pool was larger than it appeared it would be from our balcony eleven floors up. The balcony, too, was nice, with a view of the Disneyland Resort in the background, which I was told would be a great place to view the

Great spot.  We made arrangements through VRBO and were very pleased.  With two kids and the chaos that brings with a trip to Disneyland the cost was outstanding, location very god and the room quite nice.  The only downside was the pitch to get us to sit through a time share presentation.  They did offer $ as an incentive so I did not feel obligated to sit through the presentation if I didn't take the dough.  In addition to a nice room, two bedrooms and living area, there was private parking and a great pool and recroom for the kids.  Will definitely be back.

The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. We had a wonderful view of the fireworks at Disneyland right from our balcony. The room had a full kitchen and table. Everything you need. I recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Very clean and close to Disney
Summary: We stayed here during the Disneyland Half Marathon week. It was close and easily accessible. We were able to walk each day to Disneyland without any concern. The leader was very friendly and while he was unable to help us with our situation, he was understanding and did the best he could. The rooms were clean and nice. A little small, but we weren't in the room a lot.

I have stayed at several Wyndham resorts and this is one of the worst. It all started when the room was not ready on time. They would not take no for an answer on the timeshare pitch. Took us forever to get to our room because the elevators are so slow. They did not provide shampoo, conditioner or lotion. We were only given a couple towels which I thought quite odd for a 2 bedroom that sleeps 6. Internet is fee based and you can only purchase it day by day or a 10 day block. The beds were way too firm. The front side of the building was a little sketchy. I was confronted by a belligerent drug addict in front of the building who demanded that we give him money. Thankfully security seen me motion for them to help. Cops had to be called. On the positive side, staff was really nice.
Manager Response: We are truly sorry that this owner had some unfortunate situations arise during their stay. As all resorts we do our best to provide a smooth check-in process in a timely manner. We will continue to focus on this issue and make improvements in the future. We apologize for the unfortunate interaction you had out front as well. We hope that you will give us another opportunity in the future to enjoy a better vacation experience with us.

Summary: Stayed as a Wyndam owner and very well pleased with everything and most everyone. Met with Violet for and update and she was engaging, informative and understood we were satisfied with our present ownership without pressure to do anything else. The property is beautiful, a half mile walk from Disneyland and great view of fireworks from rooftop. There is transportation available running every 20 minutes to Disney for $5 a head.  Very satisfied with master bedroom. Second bedroom had two twin beds and no private access to second bathroom.  Felt we had enough lounging room in living area and all modern appliances.  Would book again.

Very clean hotel you wouldnt think of wearing slippers inside your room thats how clean the room is. The kitchen is complete with spices available with dish washer. Kids will also enjoy staying at this hotel coz of the amenities. Would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: One of the Nicest Worldmark Properties We've stayed at
Summary: Been a Worldmak owner for about 10 years, this is the 1st time staying at this property.  Property is one of the Nicer Worldmark's I've stayed at.  Nice Pool and very Friendly and helpful staff.  Parking garage is secured (need a key to get in) and is separated from the Main building.  There is a nice sized pool, children's pool and a couple of hot tubs.  Wish there was barbeques on larger patios but they are located down by the pool (which is not bad if you have to put them in a common area).  Art Bus stops right out front to take you to Disney ($5 a day or you can get multi say passes).  Disney is only about a 15-20 minute walk, but who wants to make that walk when you will be walking all say at Disney.  If you want to do a sales presentation (or owner upgrade) they will give

Summary Heading: Not as good as most Worldmark properties.
Summary: I have been a Trendwest then Worldmark owner for many years. The units are ok, not nearly as nice as you would expect for the amount of credits. Location to Disneyland is not great, about a mile away. The ART does pick up out front, but when you have small children waiting around for a bus is not what you want to do. Pool area is very nice. No matter what they offer you, do not go to any owner presentations! You will never get out!

Summary Heading: Great Family Resort. Updated and clean. EZ walking to the parks
Summary: We stayed here in Feb 14 after driving up from Worldmark Oceanside. A great spot. This place felt like a full service hotel then a timeshare property. The staff was great but a little pushy on the "owner update", free breakfast. Just know that your "parking pass" is their invitation to wow you with gifts etc. If you have the time, do it. if not then just say your not interested. Parking was secure with ample trollys available. We found the elevators busy so located another down the hall. Rooms are funky and clean with no issues. Enjoyed the pool and hottubs.

Stayed here for one night.  Upon check in, our room wasn't ready yet so the staff offered to call us when the room was ready.  We were fine with that. We just hung out in the pool.  They called me an hour later.  The staff were so friendly & nice.  I just didn't like the fact that they try to make us go to the timeshare presentation.  I am on a vacation and don't have time for that.    Our room was a one bedroom condo with separate living room area, fully equipped with washer/dryer & full kitchen.  It's a really nice room.  The location is great with 7-11 next door & plenty of restaurants across the street(Cheesecake Factory, bubba gumps, PF Changs, Roy's, etc.).  Disneyland is like a 15 min walk.  Hotel offers a shuttle for $5.     I would definitely stay here again.

We flew in to LAX and made our way to the resort after picking up our car rental.  Our room wasn't ready yet, so Miquel directed us to some nearby restaurants (there are plenty) and a Target and grocery store.  Since we were still on EST, it was our dinner time, so we went out to eat and they called to let us know when the room was ready.  After stocking up at the store, we went back to check in.  Check in was super easy.  There weren't any luggage trolleys available, but we only had 3 suitcases for the 5 of us and our grocery bags, so we didn't need one.  We never had any problems finding a parking spot in the garage and you do need to a key card to gain access. Also, the drive to check in is not on W. Katella.  It's on S. Zeyn.  We had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom unit (both had

This review is for July 2013, but I am posting a year later (and my oldest date option is September 2013).  We flew in to LAX, rented a car, and drove to Worldmark Anaheim for a 4pm check-in on a Monday.  It's a large complex, with two driveways to check in.  It was very busy, and our room wasn't ready - there were quite a few people whose rooms weren't ready, the lobby was very busy.  We were allowed to leave our luggage with the front desk at baggage check but there were no luggage trolleys left.  Luckily we managed to get one just as we were about to give up - we were able to get a trolley and leave our luggage with the front desk - we got our parking pass and so we parked in the parkade and started walking toward the Garden Walk mall complex, which was across the street -

I needed a place close to Disneyland at the last minute since my family members had already booked their accommodations before I was given holiday time to tag along.  I found the WorldMark and decided to take the plunge. There are a few paid shuttles from LAX to Anaheim.  It did not take too long, since Anaheim is a bit of a drive from Los Angeles.  The WorldMark is huge!  Check-in process was smooth and soon I was in the lift bound for a room. I was shocked at the size of the one-bedroom since the WorldMark looks like a hotel from the outside.  The standard room was amazing!  Full size WC, a proper kitchen, and a living room.  WiFi was fast and all the appliances worked.  The AC was great (needed in SoCal even in January).  The room was spotless and felt more like a small

Summary Heading: Great Family Condo Resort for 6 nights vs just renting Hotel Rooms!
Summary: This is our 3rd family group trip to Disneyland (2010, 2013, 2014). We usually rent a 4 bedroom house with pool walking distance from the park when there are 8 of us.  But this time there were just 6 of us so we thought we'd try a condo for our 6 night visit (grandparents, my daughter and her husband, grandkids 6 & 8yr olds). We actually loved this convenient location and renovated unit much better vs the dated houses offered thru VRBO.  We felt like we were in a very nice resort and it definitely beat paying for 2 adjoining hotel rooms for about the same price.  So nice to be together with living room and full kitchen; plus the services, free parking and amenities were great!  Although we asked for pool/park view we didn't get it---but it was fine since you can view Disney

Summary Heading: Nice place to call home on a Disneyland vacation
Summary: Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at Worldmark Anaheim. We spent 9 days in a two bedroom unit. Compared to other Worldmark properties, this feels more like a hotel and less like a resort, but as popular as it was I see the need for the high rise building and not a resort feel. We felt that the layout of the resort rooms were smaller than anticipated, but they were large enough for my wife, myself, and our four boys to have plenty of room. I enjoyed being able to cook in our unit in a well arranged kitchen. The pool was always crowded, but everyone was polite and we didn't have any issues. We were looking forward to watching Disneyland fireworks from the rooftop hot tubs, but they were always crowded as well. We were able to watch the fireworks off of our balcony (we were on the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I stayed here in September 2010. It was for my wife's 40th birthday and she wanted to go to Disneyland on her birthday. Our hotel was just down the road and we walked to Disneyland each time. The room was great and comfortable with plenty of space. I cannot complain about that. It was surprising that their was a lack of a restaurant in the hotel, to which we ate out elsewhere anyway. There is the Cheesecake restaurant just a couple of doors down, which is fantastic and California Kitchen, which is good also. The pool area is nice, but we didn't use it because it was a little cold at the time. There is only one lift in the place, but they may have upgraded recently, which was really slow and oddly laid out. Anyway, we had a great time and will go back if ever called

We stayed here for three days, when we visited Disneyland. Everything about this room was perfect. Shuttle took us directly to Disneyland, though you could walk there if you want to. Room service options were limited (but were available), but we went back to the room to sleep, so that was not a concern. Rooms were spacious. Beds were comfortable.

Just returned from a 5 night stay here with husband, daughter, SIL and grandson.  We were in a 2 bedroom on the 7th floor of this 14 story building and didn't have much a view but we were pretty much gone all day and exhausted at night so didn't mind.  The "balconies" are barely wide enough to step onto anyway; you couldn't sit there.  We are WM owners and got the pitch for breakfast which went on way too long but we did manage eventually to politely decline.  I was sure I had read that they only allowed one parking pass per unit but they gave us two and didn't sound like it was out of the ordinary to do so.  The unit was very nice and clean upon check in.  Everything worked and there were plenty of dishes for the 5.  We cooked breakfast every day and one dinner but other than

This experience will never be forgotten. Well check-in was a hassle. The man at the desk was very rude and thought very highly of himself. He pretty much put us down because we were Wyndham owners and not a Worldmark owner (since this hotel is owned by Worldmark). Check in is at 4, we arrived early so in a nasty tone said it might be ready later. Only one floor is dedicated to Wynham owners and its only on the 5th floor :-( So no view of Disneyland unless you go to the roof. The room was in "Very Used Condition". Lots of carpet stains, dirty cabinets, dust bunnies, a nasty washer unit, hard water stains, dirty shower floors, coffee maker that has never been cleaned and marks on walls. We just came from the Indio location so we felf spoiled after staying there. Never will return
Manager Response: We will work to continue to improve our check in experience at the front desk for our Wyndham owners. The units have been recently renovated with new carpet, paint and granite counter tops to enhance our Wyndham owner's vacation experience. We hope your will return to the Anaheim property in the near future and enjoy the new renovations.

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo for a week.  We enjoyed the pool. We enjoyed the hot tub on the roof (and watched the fireworks at Disneyland!).  We took advantage of the ART shuttle to and from Disneyland park ($6 per day or less if you buy a multiday pass).  The staff was awesome! We had a minor plumbing issue the last day and they responded immediately!  I'd recommend this place.  Lots of room, lots of comforts.  Perfect!

Overall, a very nice WorldMark property. Rooms were nice, clean & great layout. You can see Disneyland & fireworks from your window/micro balcony (if you're on the correct side) or from the Rooftop. Located right next to Gardenwalk & restaurants. 15 minute walk to Disneyland or shuttle (our experience with shuttle was that you always had to wait, a few times very crowded & 1 time our driver got lost). We ordered groceries from Vonns online & they delivered to WM who placed them in our room. We skipped the timeshare presentation. Overall very good experience.

Summary Heading: Ideal place to stay if your eye is into the theme parks.
Summary: The only high rise along that road just 15 minutes walk to Disney Land. A free service bus to Disney Town every 15 minutes. The units are family oriented with a complete kitchen and laundry facilities in the unit. There is a well maintained swimming pool beside the building. There are at leas 4 car rental companies across the road and  in within the block.

The resort itself is fine; however the customer service is incompetent. Made a request prior to arrival to have the 2 twin beds joined - never as issue at any other WM resort. Arrived and it wasn't done. Parties for that room weren't arriving til the next day so we made the request again the next morning. 3pm and the bed is still not made. Took over one hour and 4 calls to the front desk to get a simple task done. When you come back from 7 hours at Disneyland and want to rest, this is not what you want to deal with!
Manager Response: We will continue to work with the staff to improve our customer services to have requests completed in a timely manner. Follow up with the guests is essential to ensure all request have been completed fully to their satisfaction. We hope your will return to the Anaheim property in the near future and give us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional vacation experience.

Summary: Great stay at the Worldmark Anaheim, rooms were spacious and very well-appointed for use by families. Had the intention of booking tours online and direct with the providers, but found an awesome travel agent in the Anaheim Garden Walk complex behind the hotel which booked everything for us at really reasonable prices - from Universal Studios transfers, to Hollywood Highlights day excursions and even shuttle services to the shopping outlets, The Cleaver Brothers' "Discount Tickets" did everything for us! Highly recommend this company and for all travellers wanting to enjoy their time in LA without the stress of organising tours and transfers.

We stayed here with time share accommodations and it was like staying in an apartment. It was clean and huge and... like a little home away from home. The place is very modern. It lacks charm and is sort of dull but its nice, clean and spacious. If you plan a stay for longer than 3 days in Anaheim I would definitely recommend this place. The kitchen was awesome and the pool was very nice. Grills by the pool made for a fun lunch option and the walk to the parks isnt bad either. Definitely coming back.

Summary Heading: New Year's Eve and Day at Disney!
Summary: We had a great stay at Worldmark Anaheim. We are Worldmark owners and snagged the 2 bedroom penthouse suite for New Year's Eve and Day. Beautiful accommodations on the 14th floor, completely modern and fully equipped. Stayed as a family of four, twin beds in second room were a little wobbly, honestly hope they replace those mattresses but King bed in master was perfect. The bathroom was also fantastic in the master. My only complaint is the slow elevators. Busy times it took us forever to get up and down and taking the stairs fourteen floors with two littles was not an option. Great, central location to not only Disney but also Anaheim Garden Walk with several choices to eat a few blocks out the door and direct ART pickup out side the hotel doors.

We were assured  we could overnight a package to the front desk and it would be waiting for us the next morning. Even though we had delivery confirmation and the name of the employee who signed for it, we left after a week w/o our package, w/o an apology, w/o compensation, and w/o any desire to stay there again. We spoke to at least two people every day as they bounced us to one person after another and got nothing from any of them but "It's not my fault." mentality. One lady gave us hope when she promised to speak to her director and call us right back but two days later we still hadn't heard from her and gave up. We have stayed at Worldmark in several locations and this was a whole new experience. Give up extra points to stay in Anaheim, time share taxes, Wi-fi charges,

Summary Heading: Livin'n in the heart of Mouse Country
