Summary: Located only a short distance to Disneyland, this place is a real gem.   It's one of the best timeshare facilities on the face of the earth.  Half the rooms face the park so you can watch the fireworks each evening from the comfort of your room, or you can go to the roof patio and watch it from there.  The rooms are well appointed and comfortable and the service is top notch.  The timeshare people are there to greet you and get you signed up for their sales pitch, but don't take the first offer.  It started with a free breakfast but with resistance it ended up $125.00 in Disney Dollars, which can be used for anything in the park....and the free breakfast.  They promise only 45 minutes, but if you let them they will take hours trying to sell you.

Summary Heading: Clean, safe, comfortable, location butNot worth extra charge.
Summary: Hotel charges timeshare owners unexpected anaheim city tax of 155.00. Already paying a lot monthly for time Share and maintenance fees. Since I own the timeshare should not have been charged a hotel city tax. The two Bedroom suite was very nice and clean. I was given view of warehouse and I-5 Next door. Maybe because I complained about the extra charge I was not given choice for view of disneyland? There is no restaurant inside and no grocery store either. They Charge if you want to use wi-fi on cell Phone. Did not go to free breakfast to avoid another timeshare pitch. Garage Parking had gates was very safe. They Also had security patrolling constantly.

WorldMark Anaheim is also, at least on one floor, Wyndham Anaheim -- apparently a conversion by Wyndham who owns WorldMark.  The location is great if you're going to Disneyland or the California Adventure, and not bad for Knotts Berry Farm either.  There is a shuttle to Disney for a price, but it is not a long walk.  The nearby freeways can take you anywhere in the Los Angeles vicinity, though there is that LA traffic.  Long Beach airport is convenient  The hotel is nice, the inside corner rooms (overlooking the pool) have a view of the nightly fireworks at Disney.  The pool is nice, but closes at 10:00, which is too early.  The rooftop spas are packed with kids until their 10:00 closing, too.  Perhaps the hotel could have adult-only hours after that.  The room was nice, and

we love worldmark Anaheim. the staff are friendly, the rooms are great (this stay we used a 2 bed suite) and the kids love it because it is close to Disney. Unfortunately in 2 years the lifts haven't improved, however we weren't in any real hurry so it didn't really matter. We noticed on the 2nd morning that we were itchy which we believe was the sheets, but threw them in the washer and dryer and problem was solved. The washer and dryer are an added bonus and meant that I didn't have to find a laundromat or drag a bag of dirty clothes home. We decided this time to base the last 2 weeks of our stay here, rather than relocate to LA - it was a great decision.

Summary Heading: Watch Disneyland fireworks from your room!
Summary: We stayed here for Thanksgiving week and found it to exceed expectations.  I've stayed in more than a dozen different Worldmark resorts and so far this is one of the best.  We were on the 6th floor and could watch fireworks everynight at 9:30, and when we got board with that we watched them the last night from the roof jacuzzi.   Stayed in a two bedroom and found it spacious with appropriatly sized furniture unlike a few other Worldmarks....although if you need the murphy bed it will be tight.  We had a TV in each bedroom and one in the livingroom, so everyone could get their space when needed. You can walk to Disneyland, or you save your energy and take the shuttle....maybe even come back to the room midday and return for the evening.   Shuttle picks up out front and is about

Pros:  Walking distance to Disney All staff were real friendly The room was clean, spacious (we had a 1 bedroom), and had a great view of the nightly fireworks at Disney. Plenty of resturants to choose from at the Garden walk which was 5 minutes walking from the hotel.  Cons: The one elevator took forever to get to the lobby.

Summary Heading: Not the usual Wyndham resort room types
Summary: I booked this with my Wyndham membership and the room type was listed as similar to hotel room. Well it wasn't. I wasn't expecting to walk in late at night after a long trip to find that I had to rearrange the living room to pull the bed out of the wall. Even though I was on the 12th floor I could still hear traffic from below. The elevators are the slowest I have ever seen in a building of this size. So if in a rush for get trying to get any where.

Didn't know until we got home when wife broke out in rash weeks later.  Remember seeing signs of it on sheets.  We know its from there because we did not take any trips since then and pin pointed time frame when doctor said she contracted it.  Wont be staying there again.  Heard this is common in time shares as rooms don't get cleaned as often as in regular hotels which have daily cleanings. Too bad because rest of trip was ok.  Just a pushy slick salesman at breakfast who didn't score a sale with us.  Typical of pushiness of Worldmark trying to keep selling to owners.

Summary Heading: Smallest room ever, for $1800 a week!
Summary: We have stayed in many condo type units and this is the worst we've ever been in.  We knew the room had a Murphy bed and that fidn't bother us. But I never expected to have to move the couch ourselves to open the bed. This room is so tiny that with the couch pushed to the other wall and the bed open, you can't sit on the couch. I asked the desk if we could move and they told me to call reservations, which I did, but they told me there was nothing available. There are no amenities to speak of in this facility, not even a small shop to get any food. You have to pay for Internet. This place was ridiculously expensive for what you get. There are lots of nice places in Anaheim to stay for much better value. Steer clear of this one.

Summary Heading: Nice property. Good facilities. Need another elevator.
Summary: Our family of 5 recently stayed at the Worldmark Anaheim. We had an enjoyable stay. Our room was of a reasonable size and enough to accommodate 5. Our eldest slept on the foldout. The best part of the hotel for me were the facilities. The business room was barely used therefore the PC's were always available and at no extra cost. I used the gym twice and while there weren't many machines there was enough for what I wanted. The pool was quite big but there were always a lot of people there. The games room for the kids is a good benefit and kills some time. We came to Anaheim so that we can go to the theme parks. The Worldmark is about a 1km/1.5km walk but the walk is pleasant and you can walk through the Shopping Centre which is surprisingly very quiet most of the time.

We have been members of Worldmark for years now and own two accounts. The Anaheim resort is one of our favorites. We have 4 small children so we enjoy taking them to Disneyland every so often. The resort has very nice rooms that sleep all 6 of us. Having kitchens saves tons of money on food. The ART bus picks you up right in front and is very affordable. The hotel also has a great swimming area on the ground floor as well as two additional hot tubs on the roof. Only complaint I have is the pushiness of the front desk people trying to get you to attend an "owner update" breakfast. Of course, this happens at a lot of Worldmarks but I wish they would lay off and quit trying to sell you more points or other things you don't want. Aside from that, I would highly recommend staying

Summary Heading: Can I please live here forever?
Summary: These rooms are available through timeshare I believe. My friend had the space to celebrate her and her husbands wedding anniverssary. Just a few things that caught my attention. 13th floor views out looking the pool , spa and the Disneyland park. The night sky lit up with fireworks was just like the fourth of July. The suite was two rooms two bath. Warm inviting decor. Fully stocked kitchen with exquiste cookware and dishes. We created wonder meals and drinks in this kitchen. Plenty of space for 20 guests, family of 4 to 5 or cozy for a couple to not get in each others way. I enjoyed the fireplace, large flat screens tv's, furniture and virtually everything. Staff was courteous, lots of tourism since it's right in the heart of Disneyland Anaheim.

Overall a favorable experience with our first stay at the Worldmark Anaheim.   Pro's:  - Proximity to Disney: You could walk but we drove and were thankful after the miles we accumulated at the theme park. - Easy on and off freeway. Lot's to do in the area.We also drove the 40 or so minutes to Universal Studios. - Room size. We stayed in the 2 bedroom and it was nice and roomy. - Front desk staff. We met up with Audra and she was very helpful and courteous.  Con's - High pressure sales for owners. They offered us 75 Disney Dollars so we could not refuse. The desk indicated it would only take 45 minutes but they held us for more than an hour and the salesman was less than friendly when we repeatedly told him "No" on upgrading our account to Travelshare. - Special Needs Room: We

Summary Heading: Still one of my favorites, just a couple problems this time
Summary: We have stayed at this resort many times, so we know the layouts and the staff often remembers us on sight.  This trip was with 2 very good friends who had never been to any Worldmark property so we were very anxious to see how they liked it.     Check in was smooth as usual, we were early so we brought our things in on the bell cart and they held it for us, something we always love and appreciate.    When we got into the room we were terribly disappointed - it was nothing like any two bedroom unit we had ever stayed in, and we had stayed in 2 bd units not less than 20 times.  Usually there is the Master bedroom, the kitchen and living room/dining area and then the other bedroom on the other side of the living room.  Not this time, The unit was considerably smaller than any of

Summary Heading: Very clean, and very close to Disneyland.
Summary: The two bedroom we had was very clean and stocked with a nicely equipped kitchen (dishwasher, oven, microwave, toaster, blender, good knives, pans etc. adequate dishes and utensils for the 6 of us.  With a king sized bed in the master room there is also a private bath with a shower/tub, hair dryer, etc.  The other bedroom had a queen sized bed.  The living room had a comfortable queen sized folding couch/bed, dining table that sat 6 and a counter bar at the kitchen.  The common bath had everything the master room had but with also a washer and dryer.  The pool area with bbq's were well maintained.  The roof has a great view of Disneyland's fireworks that you can even enjoy from a hot tub!  The staff were always helpful.  There is a shuttle that you can take to Disneyland that

Our family shares a timeshare membership, and as Disneyland annual passholders, we make regular use of these units as well as those at the nearby Dolphin's Cove property. The insides of these units are either recently remodeled or just very new, as everything is in excellent condition. Having laundry in the unit is a special treat (Dolphin's Cove has a shared laundry room for community use) and makes going home easy with all your clothes clean and laundered. The balconies are tiny, but those on the back and side of the property have a great view of the fireworks at Disneyland. Literally across the street is The Cheesecake Factory, which can be dangerous for the waistline but is never a bad dinner decision. Avoiding the pressure of the sales team can be difficult.The check-in

A 2-bedroom condo for our trip to Disneyland and California Adventure with our family group of 6. What a help to have a full kitchen and lots of play space. We even had room to set up our own little Christmas tree and stockings for Christmas morning. A shuttle to Disneyland that runs frequently. Walking distance to several good and better restaurants. Views of Disneyland's nighttime fireworks from the room! And, if you don't get one of the rooms with a view of the park, there is roof-viewing so no one misses out. We're here almost annually.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: first of all to all the comments about elevators to this hotel, we NEVER had a problem ONCE. There are 4 elevators and we never had to wait more than 90 seconds for one. we stayed for a week and the hotel was full so think we did ok. The rooms are spacious and clean. If you face the pool you get to see the fireworks at night. Very friendly helpful staff. Would rebook without second thoughts

This was our first time staying at the Worldmark Wyndham in Anaheim.  We bought into the timeshare program last year and we booked a studio room for our first stay.  What initially sold us was the location of the property (less than a one mile walk to Disneyland's main gate) and the friendliness of the staff.  Upon our arrival at 8pm on a Thursday, we were promptly greeted and had no trouble checking in.  The staff was very helpful and provided us with tips on getting to Disneyland quickly and gave us coupons for use at a couple of restaurants at the nearby (about two blocks) Garden Walk.  I didn't have high expectations for the studio, we knew going in that it would be a small area with a murphy queen bed.  Even so, I was pleasantly surprised at the space we did have,

WorldMark hotel was an excellent choice both in terms of the stay there, and its location. It is relatively near to Disneyland and California Adventure (purpose of stay). My family booked a a suite there fully furnished with all amenities. The place was clean, and it totally felt like home. Best place to retreat after a long day at the Disney Parks. The best part, Cheesecake Factory is just across the road!

Summary Heading: OK place to stay, but barely a 3 star hotel
Summary: Worldmark in Anaheim is an OK place to stay if you are OK to be almost a mile from Disneyland and don't care too much about your accommodations. This outdated facility is in need of a major upgrade and better cleaning and amenities. First the POSITIVES ... 1) really only about .8 miles from the park and close to the Anaheim Garden Walk which makes the walk a bit nicer. 2) Hot tubs on the roof - quite nice place to watch the Disney fireworks - but dont stay to the end as it could take 1/2 hour to get down on the very slow elevators   3) King Beds in the one bedroom units. 4) Nice warm pools .... - now the NEGATIVES   1) Very smelly halls and stairs- stay away from units that end in 01 thru 04 as they are near the trash bins in the halls. These really smell and when using the

close enough to walk to disney. approximately 1 mile compact 2 Bedroom unit.  roof deck ideal for watching Disney fireworks. parking is free and covered. a lot of gourmet dining nearby - Fire/Ice (G Ramsey). Cheesecake factory, McCormick, etc

Stayed with a family member that has time shares.  Nice front desk, especially Jack.  Poor layout of condo.  Furnishings were worn and of poor quality.  Even the TV's were the cheapest ever. Worst soap possible in the bathroom.  The hot tubs (2) on the roof were a good idea.  You can watch the Disneyland fireworks from there.  Good location overall.  Bus to Disneyland if needed right outside that leaves about every 20 minutes.   The Garden walk is a short distance away.  But it was a good example of why you should not buy time shares.

Summary Heading: Always enjoy my stay at WM Anaheim
Summary: Let me preface this by saying that I am a 15 yr WM Owner.  I don't think I'm biased because there are some properties in the WM system that I don't think are all that hot. :) Well, I've stayed at the Anaheim location (the newer one on Katella) several times and I LOVE IT!!! On this trip, we had a 2bdrm unit.  I was so sad that this was my last weekend stay as I was permanently moving from Southern California (stayed a few nights before this at the Indio location). I always enjoy this resort.  It's close to Disney (you can take a few blocks walk or take the shuttle) but what I love is I always get a room where the balcony/patio door faces Disney so the fireworks at night are spectacular!!!! Highly recommend this resort. The staff are great! Lots of things to do in the area that

Summary Heading: thumbs up for worldmark anaheim ca 4 BR Predesidential
Summary: Excellent resort, huge space, beautiful decor. Walking distance to Disney Resort, and restaurant, like cheesecake factory. The swimming pool is great for the whole family , you can even have a small bbq party . They even offer free coffee and donut for breakfast.  I will defenitely coming back, one of our best resort.

Summary Heading: Better than Most, a Home away from Home while at Disney
Summary: The Worldmark by Wyndham is one of only a couple of Time Shares in the immediate vicinity of Disneyland. Its basically 3 Long Blocks from the main entrance. We stayed here in July 2013 and rented direct from an owner in Salt Lake running under the name of 5 Star Resorts Plus. (I‚Äôd probabally try to book thru a different company if I stayed here again). We paid just about $1800 for a week when everything was said and done. We had unit 1005, which I think is an overflow unit that the Worldmark rents out?  In any event here‚Äôs my take on it. The property is well above any/most of the chain Hotels in Anaheim and believe me in my dozen or so times to Disney I‚Äôve stayed at most of them. This was by far the most comfortable stay I have had in Anaheim, but also the most I‚Äôve paid for

We recently stayed here, while on a trip to Disneyland. The resort is within a long walk to the theme park main entrance, with a short cut through the Anaheim Gardenwalk, which makes it pretty convenient. Knowing that this is a time share establishment, I expected it to be in pristine condition with good service. First off, the elevators are Extremely slow. They have two main elevators with additional options at either end of the hotel wings. We ended up taking the stairs most of the time. One of these was shared with the staff and smelled terrible. They apparently used it to bring the garbage down.  Maintenance was not necessarily up to par. Someone had run into the corner wall outside of our unit and the drywall remnants were still on the floor when we left, five days later.

This is a timeshare condo style hotel. It is clean and nice. The good part was the full kitchen, the pool, and the price. The bad was the elevators are really slow, the rooms are nice, but nothing special, and every time you come and go, you have to go through the main lobby that is very crowded and overstaffed with employees. The water in our room never did get above luke warm, ever, and the water actually got shut off one day when we were trying to get ready. All in all, it was a nice experience, and we would definitely stay here again at the price we paid.

Summary Heading: My do's and don't list for Worldmark (we are owners)
Summary: Do's -stay here if you are going to Disneyland.  Shuttle service and walking distance!  -Cheescake factory, PF Changs & Calif Pizza Kitchen- all are 1 block away -cheer if you get a lower level room (elevator gripes in the Don't section) -Get the FREE coffee in the lobby -play in the pool.  HUGE!  kids pool too -park the lowest you can in the garage--- the garage is NOT connected each level to the hotel.  you must elevator down to the bottom floor, exit garage, then into resort- then up the resort elevator to your room. -bring a BRITA water filter whenever you travel.  city water-  yuck. -Walk to downtown disney!  thru Garden Walk -go to roof at 9:20pm for the view of the Disneyland Fireworks!  -check Anahiem Angels website.  Every Friday there are fireworks, if your room faces

Summary Heading: Great location for families to visit Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 3 nights while we visited Disneyland (2 adults, 2 kids and a baby). It was the ideal way to do it.  The shuttle service to Disneyland left from right outside the front door, came regularly and we always got a spot on it. It was great to be able to come home for a siesta and a swim in the pool (pool towels supplied!) and cook dinner in the kitchen, which is fairly well set up and then easily head back for more Disney time.  The staff were helpful and friendly, the pools are good and the view of the Disneyland fireworks from the roof was a bonus.  The kitchen was fairly well stocked for a basic stay and there is a washer and dryer in the apartment. The beds were comfy and the rooms were nice and dark and quiet  and large. 2 bathrooms was also

We are Wyndham owners and stayed in a 3 bedroom with children and grandchildren.  We stayed at Dolphin Cove last year.  We enjoyed our stay at Worldmark as their location is better with access to restaurants and easier access to bus ride to the gate at Disney.  It was the least amount of pressure to spend time at the timeshare presentation that we have experienced.  We definitely will return.  Grand kids loved pool and game room.

My husband and I stayed at this Worldmark Anaheim hotel for only one night, at the end of our trip, prior to flying out of LAX the next day.  This hotel had the best customer service upon check in that we've ever experienced.  (Sam checked us in and was extremely friendly and helpful.)  He helped us out by changing our room and giving us a room where the balcony overlooked Disneyland so we were able to see the Disney fireworks from our balcony at 9:30 PM. Great view! Disney is about a mile away from this resort, but is still in walking distance. We're current Worldmark owners and will stay here the next time we're in Anaheim or plan to go to Disney.

Our family of three stayed for three nights in a one bedroom unit.  I'm a Wyndham owner and this measured up to other Wyndham properties.  The unit was very clean and spacious with plenty of room for three.  Our room was located at the 'bend' of the building so the balcony had two chairs on it, which most don't.  The room also faced the pool so we could watch the Disneyland fireworks from the balcony.  We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice.  The free parking garage next store is a great amenity.  The staff was very helpful and friendly and the timeshare 'push' wasn't too bad.  One 'no thanks' and I wasn't bothered again.  The parks are about a mile away so you can walk.  We opted to drive because I didn't think our son could handle the walk back after a long day at

Summary Heading: Just a short walk to Disneyland
Summary: This is a great place for family to stay and visit Disneyland.   The rooms are large, and the Kitchen is all there.  Just down the street is a Safeway for supplies.   I considered purchasing the pass for the shuttle to Disneyland, but the front desk told me we could walk faster than the shuttle, and they were right. We walked to teh park every day.   The roof top hot tub has a view towards the park.  We sat one night and watched the fireworks from the hot tub.  It was nice, but better to stay at the park ans see them up close.   As usual WorldMark will try to sell you a TimeShare.  That is the one downside of WorldMark.  I don't know why they try.  As a WorldMark owner, I already have been sold. I bought.  And I don't need to buy more.  I particularly don't need to be hassled

We visit Disneyland every year and this is the first time we've stayed at Worldmark Anaheim. We loved the fact that we had a kitchen, washer and dryer and living space unlike staying at a hotel. Such a better way to visit Disneyland as we were able to eat a healthy breakfast each morning before heading out for the day. We also liked having the Garden Walk just a few steps away. We enjoyed the closed parking garage (free) and the pool area was nice too. We had excellent customer service and Gordon went above and beyond! We will definitely come back and stay here next time.

We stayed at Worldmark Anaheim from May the 2nd to the 19th. I can not fault this place, we love how the staff are so friendly and helpful. The units were very clean, we stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom unit. There was 2 adults and 3 kids my eldest stayed on the fold out couch which was good enough for the time we were there. We had a fantastic view from our balcony of the pool, mountains and Disney fireworks. We were on the 7th floor. We found the rooms to be very sound proof not once did we hear noise from another room. The only thing i think they should do to the rooms is get better curtains, they dont block enough of the morning sun. We heard a lot of bad feedback about the lifts, but to be honest we never waited any longer that a minute even when it was busy. The staff were

Travelers were 2 adults, a kid, and 2 seniors.  Great location for a family visit to the Disney parks.  A block away from the Cheesecake Factory and tons of other great restaurants.  Also only a short drive away from fantastic Middle Eastern food restaurants.  We stayed at a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom unit.  Very clean and tastefully decorated.  Our unit had windows facing three sides which provided plenty of natural light .  Plenty of storage room.  The hallways are very wide, which was great since we had both a scooter and a wheelchair with us.  Yes, it is true that the balconies are tiny, but we had a great view anyway--plus use of a beautifully appointed kitchen.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The only thing I would change is the blinds in the bedrooms as they do a

We have stayed here twice now and both times was a good experience.  It has a good location, close to be able to walk pretty much anywhere you want to go, Disneyland, Downtown Disney, restaurants, etc.  It is wonderful to go up to the roof to watch the fireworks from Disneyland.  The downfall is that the wi-fi is not free which I think in this day is important.

Summary Heading: The good, the bad and the ugly !!
Summary: Worldmark Anaheim, the good; Location , location, location. Adjacent to Garden Walk and very close to Disneyland. Stayed in a 2 BR unit with home like amenities, proper Kitchen with table wares, washer and dryer, comfortable accommodation for 6. Free safe parking. Top floor viewing of nightly Disney fireworks, Friendly and helpful staff. The Bad; Wi-fi is not free unless you are a Travel share member, Tiny un- usable balcony except to let fresh air in, small screen TV in Masters BR, except for swimming pool and jacuzzi, not much to do indoors. The Ugggly; annoying invites to attend owner updates aka timeshare sales presentation. If you succumb to their offer of free breakfast and  $100 Amex gift card to sit in and listen to a 90 minute sales pitch, be prepared to spend at least

Your Worldmark or RCI points don't go a long way here. It's a newer resort but I wouldn't call it a "resort." My main complaints include: no wifi in units, bath tubs way too small for a large bathroom (wasted space), small bedrooms, poor quality furniture, carpets were not very clean. Now the positives: Decor is okay, staff is friendly and helpful, close to Disney, nice parking, nice equipped kitchen.

Great location withing walking distance to Disneyland and just a block away from Anaheim Garden Walk.   We checked into a 2 bedroom unit and when we first arrived we were given a room on the 4th floor right next door to construction. I called down to the front desk to get a room change as I did not want to have my daughter smell the paint fumes as I was already getting a bit of a headache just walking in. They changed our room to the 12th floor far away from any construction. The unit itself was very comfortable however the bathrooms seemed a little too big and had a lot of wasted space.   The only downfall of the place is the owner update that they try and give. My husband specifically stated that he did not want his credit run and they did anyway. They said that it would only

Summary Heading: Handy location, small yet comfortable accommodation
Summary: Great location, with handy bus stop just outside hotel for Disneyland.  Short walk to restaurants.    Clean, comfortable rooms, I stayed in a 2 bedroom, which was clean and comfortable, although the rooms were a little small.  Can see the Disneyland fireworks from the roof top.  Will definately stay again though.

VERY CLEAN ROOM.  Great views, nice pool & courtyard (with Bbq grills) , Hot tub on the roof with knock your socks off views of Disneyland fireworks every night. The service was Great , even helped me with a dvd player @ 9:30p (duh)

I stayed here with my mother and three kids. We enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are nice and the location is fabulous. The only cons to this place is that you have to pay an occupancy fee of about $20 per night for city tax. Also, the elevators were very slow.

We stayed at the Worldmark Anaheim for 11 nights. We would have stayed longer if we could. This was truly a home away from home. the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was large, we had plenty of room to hang out together and separately. We were never tripping over one another, because the room was like an apartment. The kitchen was spacious and two of us could be in there at the same time.   Even though there were  ton of families staying during the time we were there, the rooms were very quiet...AND we were facing the pool and only on the 4th floor! We enjoyed being able to watch the fireworks from the rooftop or even our balcony. The staff were super-friendly and we would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Anaheim. The location was perfect. We were one block from

Great stay; just 15 mins from Disney Parks; we drove and parked each day. We were asked about a timeshare but just said not interested and weren't asked again. Rooms were a great size with all the amentities required.

The rooms felt a bit smaller than other Worldmark locations but that might just be my perception. But adequate nonetheless. Could perhaps do with some spare pillows as the ones supplied are small and only one per person.  The location is very good - close to shops, 7-11 half a block away, and of course Disneyland. In fact one of the parking areas for Disney is right across the street. It would be great if you could walk across the road and catch their free shuttle but I don't know if they allow that. There is a local bus network which is $5 per adult for a one-day pass, which soon adds up if you have a large group. We, ahem, drove the 1-block to the Disney car park and caught the free shuttle instead! With 7 in our minivan, the $15 parking fee was easily eclipsed. So if you park

Stayed in a 2 bedroom unit had everything we needed for our stay, Staff were friendly, parking was free, Disneyland shuttle was easy and ran every 20 minutes. The GardenWalk is a bonus being so close, plenty of restaurants within walking distance. My only complaint is they are still in that era where they charge for internet access!

in April 2011 we stayed here for 1 week nice place the location is excellent as a bus service to  Disneyland is handy right outside the hotel. We went as a family and stayed in a 1 bedroom i highly recommend this hotel only a few blocks from disneyland and you can watch the night fireworks from the balcony as we were facing the poolside. Use the bus multi pass as it cheaper.We went to Beverly hills tour and were picked up by starline tours at a nearby hotel and used lux buses to get to las vegas such a fantastic memorable holiday.So glad we have worldmark and thanks for the memories.

Worldmark made our holiday experience a memorable one. My wife and I stayed on the 8/F from 19-26 October 2012. The Resort's location is excellent, just 20 minutes walk to the main-gate of Disneyland via the GardenWalk. From our room balcony we had a good view of Disneyland nearby. In the evenings we were entertained with a beautiful fireworks display. Disneyland was the highlight of our stay in Anaheim. Worldmark Anaheim is a beautiful resort; our one-bedroom apartment was impeccably clean and tastefully decorated and the spacious kitchen was fully equipped. The H24 business centrehad 8 work stations and a high speed printer, so we were quite happy with the availability of an internet facility. However, it would have been lovely if free WiFi was made available in the apartment.

We stayed in a two bedroom for a week in November. The unit was very nice and spacious with two full bathrooms with a King size bed in the master bedroom and queen size bed in the second bedroom. There was a pull out sofa bed which was very comfortable. The balcony is very small certainly no room for a chair but still nice nonetheless to be able to open up to the outdoors. We were on the 14th floor and had a view of Angels Stadium and the Crystal Cathedral along with a view of the freeway and the tops of buildings. It was still a nice view although would have preferred view of Disneyland. You can watch fireworks from the rooftop at night and was never crowded when we were there. Unlike some other reviewers here we never had a problem with slow running elevators. We spent four

Summary Heading: A great value for a family looking to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: Pros  Large two bedroom two bath suite Nice pool Walking distance to Disneyland Friendly staff  Cons Not a full service hotel, if that's what you're looking for No daily housekeeping  They will try to sell you a timeshare membership

We just came back from 4 nights and this resort and had a wonderful time.  Being Worldmark owners, we have stayed at many of their properties and this might be one of their best.  The lobby was clean and inviting as well as the staff working there.  Almost everyone had a comment (good morning, welcome back, how was your day, etc. etc.)  I do have to say that the music in the lobby was ridiculously loud.  We had a hard time hearing any of our discussions with the staff at check-in or at the concierge. I have seen a lot of compliants about the elevators at the resort and sure there does not seem to be many for the pure size of the resort but it's not terrible.  If you hunt around there are others available so we did not find it to be a big deal.  Plus when you are coming and going

Perfect Resort & at the right location  Pros *Very Friendly Staff *Close to Disneyland *Close to Shopping (Target) *Kid Friendly Pools *Nice Shuffle Board Playing Area  Cons *two few elevators for the size of the resort *the resort should organize more onsite activities ofr guests *sales staff are very pushy *rooms are starting to show wear and tear

We stayed, at this resort, so we could take our grandkids to Disneyland. Upon arrival, I had to vacume the room because there was still food stuck to the carpet. During the week, we were there, the washer had to be repaired, the trash wasn't collected and we had to call, the main desk, for clean towels. Although, the staff was reasonably helpful, when we needed something, for next year's trip, I think we will stay someplace else.

Close enough to the park, but not walking distance. They do have a shuttle service. You can see the park fireworks from the top of the building, where they have additional hot tubs. The resort was pretty nice, but seemed a little under styled in the main lobby area. The pool was decent enough to keep my kids happy, but I would have liked the pool to be a little more fun for kids. I would go again, though. Our room was nice, and we had a nice view of the pool area.  Staff were very attentive, but the fact that there was a security guard on duty at all times made me think twice. Mostly because we were in SoCal, no bad reflection on Worldmark. Actually, good that they were taking care of us.

I stayed here for four nights with my boyfriend using his parent's timeshare. The lobby was very clean and inviting, a water tank/pitcher with watermelons in it caught my eye instantly, thought it was very cute! Staff was beyond welcoming, and we were lucky enough to have a room ready for us when we arrived at midday even though check-in was at 3pm.   The room was a good size, just right. However, the bathroom was abnormally large -- the vanity, toilet and shower we're so far apart. The balcony was tiny, but had a good view. No problems with anything in the room, didn't use the kitchen at all but the laundry equipment worked perfectly fine.   Location-wise it's great for those visiting Disneyland. It's a slight walk but you can also take the ART shuttle bus which takes 5-10

We went to Aneheim for our annual holiday in June 2012, we had booked a 1 bedroom appartment at the Worldmark Resort.  I must admit that they are very geared up for holiday makers, their check-in procedure was very quick and they have popcorn and refreshements at reception all day long.  There was a gentleman that checked us in who was very efficient and speedy, however, they do not have any bell boys, so the luggage needs to be brought in by yourself.  We had an apartment on the 10th floor, the elevators are very spacious, but they take forever to come when the button is pushed.  The apartment was not huge, but very comfortable, my daughter slept on the sleeper couch in the living room, which was comfortable for her.  The apartment has all the necessities needed, like tea,

Coming close to the end of our stay and wish it was longer!   First off there is some misinformation going around that if you call a couple of days ahead you can get a shot at a room that faces the Disney fireworks. Not true.   It's based on when you made your reservation. We made ours a year ago and got a room with a great view. So just a heads up - make the reservation early as you can for the best option!  Rooms are great. The only thing that could be better would be the tv channel options. Not a very good choice of channels. And the patio is the smallest I've ever seen in my life. Not sure what that is about.   Nearest food store is a couple miles away which is a $20 roundtrip cab ride. Transportation is not cheap. There are car rentals right around the corner. There is a

We had the opportunity to stay here for 5 nights and would highly recommend this hotel.  Everything was so easy, the staff were friendly and helpful, free carparking, free popcorn, nice pool and spas, nice clean comfortable rooms and only 10min pleasant walk to Disneyland.  You can go to the roof top and watch the Disneyland fireworks display - almost like being there!  We had 6 of us in a two bedroom appartment with 2 bathrooms, full kitchen facilities and didn't once feel like we were tripping over eachother - very spacious!  Checking in and out was easy the staff were fantastic - they would go out of their way to help.  The walk to Disneyland was through the Gardenwalk with plenty of shops and places to eat.  No supermarket in walking distance but just a quick 5 min drive

Summary Heading: Nice location, close to Disney and the freeways
Summary: We just got back from 7 days at this timeshare.  We have stayed in many very nice condos and this ranked as adequate. Nothing special about the pool or activites at the resort. The  staff was very friendly and ready to serve. The room itself looked really used although very clean.  Never have stayed with World Mark but many of the amenities that make things easier are missing.  No shampoos, soaps, etc.  Shuttle to Disney is $4.00 adults, $1.00 kids, not much but after riding free shuttles to Disney World from Bonnet Creek it was disappointing.  Lots of free parking and many restaurants, shopping close by.  Balcony which we like to sit out on, was tiny, not big enough for a chair.  Location is close to Disney and freeways but not resort like, hotel like in a big city.  One kudo

This was a great location and the amenities were great. It was an easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland but I highly recommend taking the shuttle if you have little ones (or grandparents) that wear out quickly. There is a shuttle kiosk in the lobby that is easy to use and gives you a back and forth option that saves $ over paying cash for a one way ticket.  This was our first trip here and stayed in a 3BR, there were 3 adults and 3 teenagers and a 4 year old. It provided just enough room for all of us and having a kitchen available in the suite was a really nice cost saving measure. We were able to have breakfast every morning in our room before heading out to the days adventures.  My only complaints were that the elevators were extremely slow during busy times and often so full

This was our first experience staying at the Worldmark in Anaheim as we typically stay at one of the hotels directly across from the pedestrian entrance.  We stayed in 1019, which was a 2 BR, 2 BA unit with a king in one BR and twins in the other.  There were 4 adults and 1 child under 3 in our party, so the child slept on the pull-out sofa.  It was okay for a 3 year old, but definitely not very comfortable for an adult, so keep that in mind if you have more than 4 staying in the unit. One of the twin beds was also very wobbly, although we never called it in.  Check in was easy (and we were able to check in early), but they do the typical timeshare ploy of having you pick up your parking pass at their Resort Host desk (AKA the "try to sign you up for a presentation" desk).  We

This specialty accommodation was a pleasant surprise as I initially assumed as a timeshare it would be very basic, instead it was bright & wry clean with a pool & large fitness center. ¬†The rooms were similar to a display home or 4 star hotel, but with a proper kitchen & laundry facilities. ¬†Walking distance to Disneyland & Gardenwalk mini-shopping mall. ¬†One would only stay here for the Disney visit as the surrounding areas are mainly hotels & small restaurants.

This was our second stay at WorldMark Anaheim.  It's nice to know you will get exactly what you expect which is a nice, clean, friendly place with lots of amenities.  The kids loved the pool just as much as they loved Disneyland.  At the front desk there is free popcorn in the afternoon and all the clean pool towels you would like.  It's so handy to have the laundry right in the unit.  The only demerits are the slow main elevators and the compulsion of the staff to try and sell you on more Worldmark membership stuff (they called our room daily).  If you go to the roof deck at night you can sit in a hot tub and watch the Disney fireworks show--pretty sweet!

We loved this place.  In fact, I think my wife is spoiled now and compares everyplace we stay with worldmark Anaheim. The staff was friendly and the rooms where super clean.  We felt safe and with 3 kids under 5 years old, it was important that we all felt safe and clean.   The parking garage was a plus for my wife.  It made her feel better about leaving all of our Disney stuff in the car each night. We had a small issue with our blinds being broken and they immediately fixed them and the maintenance man was very professional and polite. He even recommended some good restaurants that we would have missed had he not been willing to chat.  We will definitely stay here again.

The Worldmark Anaheim was the perfect place for our family to stay for our Disney vacation.  The property is extremely clean and well maintained, the staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful.  It's a 15 minute walk to Disneyland but there is a shuttle bus run by the city of Anaheim that stops outside the hotel.  The shuttle was cheap for 3 days of unlimited transportation (sorry, can't remember the exact price).  The building has a large swimming pool and hot tub outside the main entrance, and 2 smaller hot tubs on the roof.  The grounds are gorgeous, waiting room is beautiful, the rooms were clean and well maintained and huge.  We had 2 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms, the kitchen and a living room.  Laundry was in-suite and free.  They owners provided coffee, filters,

The location  of the resort is great. Its a couple blocks from Disneyland. The resort itself is new and seemed ok.   We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit and found the bathroom very standard and not to vacation club type. The kitchen was stocked with the basics and appliances were new but not high end.   The resort was nice but it wasn't a Hilton resort, resembled a Holiday Inn or Hampton more than a resort.  I called ahead and requested a Disney view and that request was granted which was very nice. You can see the fireworks from the property.   The problems we had during the stay were upon check in you had to get your parking pass from the timeshare sales and appointment setters and they were pushy. Also when you need to exchange towels you must go to the front desk they do not come

Summary Heading: Worldmark Anaheim - Good Disney location for families
Summary: My family and I stayed at the WorldMark for 2 nights and were thoroughly pleased.  We weren't blown away, but found very good value here.  As a family of 5, it's always difficult to find the right accomodations to stay comfortably.  Two bedrooms & a pull-out couch allowed for everyone to have their own space.  The suite was clean, nicely appointed and had all the amenities you would expect from staying at a Holiday Inn or comparable, with the added benefits of being a condo suite.  The resort also has a good pool, a couple of hot-tubs, and a good gym.  This is a condo/timeshare, so be advised you will be asked to attend a presentation, should you chose.  If you don't want free breakfast, simply & politely say 'No thank you' and the staff will comply.  Being it is a

We just got back from our trip to Disneyland (March 3-10th),Had a wonderful time..Not a relaxing Holiday though! You are walking from the time you get there ,till the time you left. Our only mistake was going to Universal studios in Hollywood..little out dated...Nothing like Universal in Orlando Florida. Our Hotel was in a great location..15 minute walk to the theme parks. Make sure you cut through Garden Walk (stripmall with some nice shops and restaurants in it) cuts of a few blocks of the walk. Worldmark Anaheim is a nice Hotel..Timeshares were not that pushy..only asked us once if we were intersested in a tour. Found the floors in unit a little dirty and the shower curtains were filmsy (stuck to you ..when showering) At this time of year, pool is very cold..Sun reaches it

Summary Heading: Pretty Trim on an Average Hotel
Summary: My family stayed at the WorldMark last week while we went to Disneyland.  The location of the hotel is good.  We chose to purchase the Anaheim Transit passes because of our small children.  However, we saw many people walk to the park without any trouble.  If you are debating the buses, I will say that they operate quite well and we never had to wait more then 10 minutes.  Aside from the location of the hotel, I would say that everything else about it is average or slightly less than average.  We have a family member who is an owner at WorldMark and booked the hotel because of the great reviews it got.  After staying there, I believe that the great reviews are due to the type of people staying there - think Larry the Cable Guy and his family.  I am not trying to be judgmental,

I loved this place, full kitchens, free parking and the staff was so helpful!!! I have stayed here multiple times and in both one bedroom and 2 bedroom rooms. Having The kitchen was so convenient for packing lunches and breakfast. The rooms are very modern, clean and have everything you could need including a washer and dryer. We will definitely be back!!!

The resort was close enough (for two adults) to walk each day to Disneyland.  If you are a family with children it may be a bit far.  The room was OK.  No attention to detail in the decor.  No curtains on the windows.  There are blinds, but our room overlooked the pool and surrounding business area.  No lights went off at night - Cheesecake Factory, La Quinta, etc.  It was VERY light and distracting.  There was one mirror in the entire unit in the bathroom.  Not full length.  There was a washer and dryer in the unit which apparently had not been pulled out to be cleaned because there was trash under the washer.  Again, just OK but I will not ever stay there again.

Summary Heading: Perfect setup for family trip to D.L. with one annoying glitch.
Summary: We booked 5 days at this resort at a pretty reasonable price through a Homeaway.com. Advance arrangements were made with the timeshare owner. This was actually an advantage because he personalized our stay a bit and also knows the hotel and their procedures, so he was able to give excellent tips.   We arrived by car and the check in was easy and the staff friendly. I did hit hit with a surprise local tax when I arrived called the Transient Occupancy Tax (TOT). It was about $12 per day, which I had to pay in advance at the check in desk.   Here is where it got a little bit weird: The check-in desk sent me to what appeared to be a concierge desk "to pick up my parking garage permit". It took too long and was actually just a disguise to sign me up for their timeshare presentation.

Summary Heading: Our mainstay in the area, always great and staff is very helpful
Summary: We love this resort.  I have lost count of how many times we have stayed here, and will be going again in a couple of weeks!  We know the staff on sight, lol.  Rooms are always clean and comfy - with the exception of the pull out couch - that is a nightmare !  But I find that most of those are, so not on them.  Murphy beds are much better.    The staff is great about extra coffee and towels.  There was a hot water issue when we were there, but it did not effect us at all.   I will stay here again, even when the taxes are a little high - they are not the ones who decide that, it is the county

I frequent this hotel as my parents are owners. The rooms are spacious and hold the majority of what you'd need in regards to dishes, cutlery, and soap. There's a gift shop in the lobby for any other items you may need.  The elevator in the front runs extremely slow, especially during the opening and closing hours of Disneyland. (Everyone is either going to or coming from). However, there is another elevator by the workout room that most guests don't know about that runs quite efficiently.  The hotel is apart of the Disney shuttle service, so for about $4 a day, I believe, you can ride the shuttle to and from Disneyland all day long. There is a stop on the corner of the street right outside the lobby. If you don't mind walking, the park is roughly a mile away with a fun outdoor

Summary Heading: Rented Worldmark from the owner and was fantastic trip!
Summary: We rented the 2Bed 2 bath from the owner and we had a great time.  it's about 1 mile from Disneyland and is completely walk-able, though with small children plan for a stroller as they get tired after a day in the park.  There is a shuttle coming every 30 min or so but it seemed late quite often and we just ended up walking about 75% of the time.  They provide all appliance soap (dishwasher, washer, dishwashing etc) and anytime you needed more coffee, sugar, soaps, towels, linens etc, they were available at all times free of charge--as much as we needed.  Also, you can request a Pack N Play and extra dishes etc.

Arrived on a Sunday late afternoon. Check-in was fast and friendly. As other reviewers have said, there is an immediate charge put on your account for the Anaheim room tax or hotel tax or whatever they call it.  Our charge for six nights was $125. Be prepared for it! Then we went to the greeting desk to get our parking pass.  Yes, they tried to sign us up for a timeshare presentation, but a polite no was accepted graciously. The one bedroom unit was comfortable and well equipped. Service for six of dishes, flatware, etc. We had a full kitchen with dishwasher and even a tiny stack washer/dryer. The bathroom was odd we thought...a huge floor space, but so poorly arranged that there was only one sink, very little storage and a small tub/shower combination. With all that floor

Summary Heading: Great Place for A Family Vacation
Summary: Our family of four booked a 2 bedroom at this resort.  Check-in was a breeze and we were in our room quickly.  The room was clean and spacious.  We were all very comfotable.  The beds were great the a/c and heat worked great.  The bedding was nice.  We had no issues with the elevators no waiting ever.  The pool area is huge and very nice, we spent quite a bit of time here and loved it.  Freeway access is close and easy.  They tell you that Disneyland is 0.8 miles away I run 5k alot and would guess this resort is over a mile away.  We walked a couple of times but it is a long way.  Taxis from the resort to Disneyland or vice-versa are about $6.00 we did that a lot.  Way cheaper and more convienient than parking at Disneyland or riding the ART shuttle.  The kitchen was stocked

My husband and I, daughter, son-in-law, and 2 grand daughters (4 & 8) stayed at this resort Sept. 25- Sept. 30th.  I reserved a 3 bedroom unit and found it to be large and very comfortable. The girls were very excited to have their own bedroom with each having their own twin bed. That made it very nice after a long day at Disneyland!  We had groceries delivered prior to our arrival. Von's had no delivery charge since we had never ordered from them before. If you let the resort know about the delivery they take everything up to your unit and put the perishables in the fridge for you. Couldn't have been easier!  My 8 year old grand daughter and I enjoyed the pool very much. She got to go swimming when her little sister was taking a nap:-)  Being so close to Disneyland made it

Great place to stay! we had a 2 bedroom suite- everything clean,and lovely- great lobby- free donuts one morning(nice) video rental in lobby- could get shuttle to Disneyland if you wanted- We walked to Disneyland,it was about a mile to get in- not bad at all- right next to Anaheim Garden walk with restaurants and shops- the only warning I have is *beware* of the pushy salespeople at checkin. This is a timeshare property,and they want to pin you down to a tour. They offered us a $75 gift card to do it,we said 'no thanks' they can be persistent,so just be aware. Otherwise,a GREAT place to stay and see Disney! There is a 7-11 right on the corner,so we could just grab any small necessities we needed easily too. We could see DL fireworks from the roof, (no music) that was nice- pool

Summary Heading: Home Base for LA and California
Summary: Perfect central location for Newport and Redondo Beaches, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Disneyland, California Adventure, Santa Ynez wine country, Malibu, Santa Barbara, Montecita, Solvang.  Friendly, helpful staff with lot of good suggestions, near great restaurants and shopping, accessible to Pacific Coast Highway and I-5. Great weather.

Summary Heading: Awesome rental.....Mark Storey was GREAT and so was Worldmark
Summary: We recently just returned home from our trip to Disneyland.  We stayed at the Worldmark in Anaheim.  We rented from owner Mark Storey and we had a very pleasant experience.  The place was SO nice and clean....exactly what I was looking for.  Had a lot of room in it and also a full kitchen and washer and dryer.  We ended up staying an extra night and our room at the Worldmark was no longer available and we had to go stay at a "normal" hotel.  I was so sad....and homesick for the Worldmark. :) I will definitely be staying here again in the future, it's the only way to go.  Thank you Mark and Worldmark for making "our dreams come true." :)

Stayed 6 nights early December 2010 in a 2 bedroom apartment overlooking Disneyland. Very comfortable, new and clean. Enjoyed our stay there and had a great time and also very relaxing. We are able to watched the fireworks from our balcony. A little far to walk to Disneyland but the bus is very convenient. We used Vons for our grocery and i must say they are very good and the fruits are very fresh.  We were lucky that the weather were perfect during our stay.

This was the perfect place to stay with kids...actually I'd stay here as a couple too.  It was clean, had modern decor, no hassles, beautiful pool area, located within walking distance to great restaurants, and we could see the Disneyland Fireworks from our balcony!!  Loved it!

Summary Heading: Loved it, close to Disneyland Downtown
Summary: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at the hotel, and we loved it. We walked to Disneyland,  California Adventure Park, Downtown Disney and the restaurants in the area. The only negative about the hotel is that it does not have a dining room or restaurant that offers breakfast or dinner. All in all we had a great time.

We stayed at the WorldMark Anaheim resort in a 3 bedroom presidential for a birthday celebration. It was awesome! The floor plan was well put together. There are two master suites at each end with a kids room (2 twin beds) in the middle. The kitchen is spacious and easy to have 3 cooks in the kitchen. You can see the tv from the kitchen as well. We were there for the opening day of football season so it was crucial for my husband to have full access to the tv. The internet worked well and we didn't have much wait time for elevators as described by some of the other people responding. We enjoyed it so much we're going back again in September...only this time - a 4-bedroom presidential! I read that it's over 2500sq feet. That's as big as our house!

Our stay was amazing. I was with my mom, sister, niece so we had the two room suite which was up to date and clean. Its proximity to the park is great as it is about a 5-10 minute shuttle ride away, or a 20 min walk (wish it was a litter closer), but we had a car so we just drove over and back.  Parking is only $15 for all day and we can come and go when we want. The rooftop held a wonderful view of the park and was a good place to watch the fireworks at night but don't olan a whole evening around the fireworks they nice to see from here but not like being thre.    It is a block from Anaheim GardenWalk where there are some nice shops and restaurants (Bubba Gump‚Äôs, Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang's, McCormick & Schmick's, etc.).   Everyone was very nice and the pool area was very

Summary Heading: This property has the potential to be much better..
Summary: We have stayed here on two different occasions.    The good points are: 1)  It is in a great location with Disneyland nearby.  It is a long walk....especially on a hot day....and not recommended if you have kids....take the shuttle or drive in.   2)  The property is very nice and comfortable...roomy, large pool, nice grounds.   3)  It is a block from Anaheim GardenWalk where there are some nice shops and restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang's, McCormick & Schmick's, etc.) 4)  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The negatives were: 1) Only two central elevators serving 14 floors which becomes a serious waiting issue during check ins and outs, especially when families are transporting luggage carts and people. 2)  Housekeeping has been hot and cold.  It appears that they

The low-cost shuttle bus to Disneyland stops right at their corner and the park is only a short distance--a few people walk but we were too tired!  Rooms are nice, typical timeshare.  The only time we had trouble with the elevators was on Sunday when many people are checking out.  Our room was near the rear elevator and we usually used that one.  We had a corner unit; the view one direction was of a freeway and the Crystal Cathedral; the other direction was the parking lot for Disney employees.

Wow, what can I say except that my stay there was amazing. I was with my family of four so we had the two room suite. The rooms were beautiful with a modern flare and clean too. The kitchen and refrigerator were great for buying food to make a meal or saving leftovers from earlier dining. It's proximity to the park is great as it is about a 5-10 minute shuttle ride away. The rooftop held a wonderful view of the park and was a perfect place to watch the fireworks at night. There are also a few restaurants within walking distance. My only complaints are that the elevator system is extremely slow and that the bus service does take a while to come if you don't time it right. Overall my family enjoyed our trip to Disneyland and enjoyed our wonderful stay at Worldmark Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Limited Amenities,, newer but dirty, NO IN ROOM Wi-Fi??
Summary: We stayed May 21-29, 2011 in a 2 BR, 2 Bath Unit on the 12th floor with a view of the I-5, Yay!. We booked this Timeshare Property through our RCI Points, for 62,000 Points, we felt extreamly ripped off, very little point value here.  This property is newer, but is in deperate need of maintenance, the upkeep is not consistant, no maid service at all, only towel exchange at the front desk!!.  The room was large enough, bit of an odd room design, with decor that was flat out ugly, not elegant at all, very cheaply furnished and finished with cheap no frills fixtures, it looks like they tried hard but but missed the mark completely. It was barely acceptable, and not what was expected of this type of property. The Room smelt funny upon arrival, I could not make out what it was, we

Summary Heading: Nice staff, Good location, needs a little maintenence
Summary: My husband, daughters ages 3 & 6 and family friend and her 6 year old stayed from April 15 - April 23 in the 3 bedroom unit that accomidates 8 people.  The staff were friendly, and the size of the unit was great - but the carpet was fraying in some areas and some obvious dings on the wall corners (not a big deal - but surprising considering how new this Worldmark is).  The elevator (busy, slow) situation was fully disclosed, so we planned for that and avoided the problem by leaving early in the mornings and later in the afternoons.  The pool area and grills were a nice break from the busiest, hottest parts of the day at the Disney Parks.  I noticed that people were waiting just outside the lobby for one of the "ART" buses (Anaheim Resort Transit) - but we just walked to the

This place was great to stay at. We got there mid morning our room wasnt ready but they were willing to hold our bags till it was. We wanted to get to Disneyland ASAP. We have a three year old that was just way to excitied! (and mom and dad) We had grocerys from Vons... Great idea to do!! We had breakfest every morning in the condo and rest of our meals in Disneyland. Washed our clothes as they got dirty.. Very handy with a three year old. Overall everything was nice. Our condo was on the 12th floor and looked towards Disneyland. It was a great place to stay the only part that was a bummer was that you had to catch a shuttle or walk. We did walk a couple of times but it is pretty far... considering you have already been walking the parks. The shuttle is nice to have but does get

Summary Heading: Not Terrible, but would NOT return unless...
Summary: We were a family of 6 for this trip, Dad, Mom and 4 teen boys.  We bought this stay, a 2 bedroom unit, 7 months before the travel date from an owner for $1860 for the week, WAY TOO MUCH for this place!  If you are looking to rent from an owner, I would say it is worth $900, maybe $1000 at the most.  I saw on the Guest Certificate that the owner paid over $1400, which is also way too much.  If this Resort was in Orlando it should not even make Silver Crown with RCI.    Check in: We arrived on a Thursday at 1pm, went to Downtown Disney, called and let them know we were in town. They said our room was not ready, but the Groceries we'd pre-ordered from Von's had been delivered and were already in the room. This is when I found out that despite the outrageous price tag and booking 7

Summary Heading: Did not live up to expectations...
Summary: Stayed from 3/26-4/2 in a 2-bedroom suite on the 12 floor, Disneyland side of the property.  Suite had 2 separate bedrooms (King and 2-twins), 2-bathrooms, kitchen and living/dining area.  Full size refrigerator, microwave, oven/range, dishwasher, garbage disposal, coffee maker, blender, etc.  Well outfitted.  This is one of WorldMark's newest properties.  First, the pros: Friendly staff (especially Security guards ++++), secure parking (adjacent building, but very close), good location for Disneyland, close proximity to GardenWalk with good restaurants, views of Disneyland and fireworks from room and roof, kids enjoyed the pool.  Well furnished kitchen.  Fitness room and kid's game room looked good, we didn't use them.  Also didn't try the business center, so can't speak on

We stayed at the Worldmark resort in Anaheim over Spring break for a week. After reading all the reveiws, I was a little uncertain about how everything would be - I have to say, the place was well beyond my expectations. The apartment we were in was on the 9th floor and it was large, roomy and very prettily done up. It's a newer place, so everything looked fresh and clean. The apartment has everything you need - all the basics, but if you are particular about brands and cleaning products like I am, you will be well served to purchase your detergent, dish soap etc from the nearby walmart or target. We were travelling with our 4 month old son, so I needed the washing machine almost everyday and the detergent they provide is not something I would use. That being said, everything

Great place to stay.  We went during the off-season for Disneyland, February.  Weather was good, park not very crowded, we were able to get onto all of the rides with short waits.  Longest line was around 30 minutes. The Hotel was very clean, everything worked great, it seems brand new.  (maybe it is, not sure).  Staff was very helpful.  The only complaint (very minor) was that our room was not ready until about 15 minutes after the earliest check-in time. We got a 2 bedroom suite, and it was excellent.  Full kitchen and gas grills by the pool area (I think 4 or 5 of them) allowed us to cook our own dinner to save lots of money. **tip** get the shuttle tickets.  It's like $10 for a 4 day adult ticket.  The hotel is close to the park, but it's almost a mile walk to the front gate

My wife and I stayed as guests of owner for our 10th anniversary in a one bedroom. We found it a great place to stay.  Check-in was actually pretty quick even taking into a count them trying to get us to accept a "presentation" The parking is in a separate and secure building. This was comforting to know your car is secure, but could be a little inconvientent when loading and unloading the vehicle. They do have a loading area that they tell you to pull up in. The problem was that when we arrived there were a lot of families that had just returned from the grocery story unloading groceries that we just parked on the street in front and unloaded. They do have tons of luggage carts that were helpful and made it so we only had to make one trip. Our room was on the 8th floor and was

It was a clean hotel. The amenities they provided was excellent in regards to the kitchen utensils. Make sure you bring your own laundry soap. The stuff they provide really does nothing. If you do they require "H E" soap. The biggest downfall is that we were there for a little over a week and we were told that when we checked in we got a free cleaning. So we called half way through to request for a cleaning. The person who answered barely spoke english and then transferred us to some different department. So we talked to the people they transferred us to and they transferred us right back. We got someone different (thank God) but they told us that most people use their free cleaning as their check out cleaning and unless we wanted to be charged the cleaning fee to just hold off.

Summary Heading: Rooftop Fireworks...next time I'll bring a bottle of wine with me.
Summary: We have stayed at several Worldmark properties and so far this is the nicest one. We stayed here mid week in April, off season so it wasn't packed. Some people have mentioned that  the elevators were alittle slow. We didn't encounter this at all. If you've been to Europe you'll survive.  PROS Five Star Customer Service  - Upon check-in we were greeted by two staff welcoming us. Check-in was easy and quick...under 5 minutes - Throughout our visit the staff was very nice and helpful Building - Nice entertainment room; video arcades, ping pong, pool, etc. - Rooftop view of the fireworks (awesome)...next time I'll bring a bottle of vino with me. - Downstairs in the lobby they have a big box where you can place your extra unused food. The food is donated to local shelter. Nice touch,

Summary Heading: Excellent, great location, would stay again
Summary: Stayed here with family for 7 nights...for the money it is great...it is one of the newer places to stay near disney....it was very nice......definately would stay again...close to disney, and easy bus availablility... I agree with one other review...it is nice and new, but they didn't do quality....like granite and tile floors...it looks nice now, but things will have to be replaced sooner than later due to marginal finishing construction products...such as linoleum and formica ....and sinks that are made of a plastic type material...tubs are not tile, and they are small...but other than that, great...it seemed nice and quiet for sleeping and a fantastic view of the fireworks...Like I said, for the money...I don't think you will get anything better...really enjoyed our stay

Summary Heading: And they even found my diamond ring.
Summary: As the other reviews said, great location for Disneyland and an easy drive the beach of LA.  Rooms are nicely furnished and kitchen is well equipped to cook full meals.  BBQs are well maintained (not always the case in some WorldMarks).  Secure parking and friendly staff.  My only complaint would be that the garbage area(s) on each floor as well as the building collection area were not kept clean and really smelled.  The smell carried into the stairwell and back elevator.  But WorldMark Anaheim has my lasting gratitude for finding a diamond ring I left. It is a family heirloom as well as very valuable.  I didn't notice it wasn't on my finger until we were at the airport.  I made a frantic call to WorldMark.  They immediately went to the room--located the ring--and within 20

Me my wife and another couple stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom presidential suite on the 14th floor for 4 nights.  The room was not facing the parks but the view was still very nice.  We tried to check in at around 11 am but the room was not ready so they got our number and would call us when the room was ready, they stored our luggage and we went to hollywood, and venice beach and sightseeing, they finally called at 3:30pm saying our room was ready.  Check in was smooth and when we went to our room we were very impressed the room was amazing full kitchen, flat sceen tvs, and a huge walk in shower with 2 big shower heads in the master bathroom, the balcony next to the living room was a good size, but the balcony outside the master bedroom was very small that no chairs can fit

This was a very nice place to stay. The rooms were equipped with everything you may need for an extended stay.  The kitchen was complete with utensils, small appliances, etc.  It even had a combo washer/dryer.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bathroom suite.  All six of us fit in the room comfortably.  Although we did not have time to utilize some of the other amenities.  The property had a roof top jaccuzzi.  The pool was heated throughout the day.  There was a playroom for the kids, workout room, and business center.  The only downside to the place was the elevators.  If you plan on leaving during the times of 8am-10am, the wait for the elevator can be up to 30 minutes!  So the best thing to do is to get on the elevator no matter if you're going up or down.  At least you'll make it

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: With 2 small children, Worldmark was a perfect location that allowed us to go to Disneyland in the morning and then a quick trip back for naps, then back again in the evening.  It was close enough to walk or the bus stopped right outside the hotel.  Our room even had a view of the Disneyland fireworks.  We will definitely stay there for our next trip to Disneyland.

The location of this resort is not bad - a short block from the Anaheim Garden Walk, and brisk walk to Disneyland and California Adventure.  We live in Los Angeles, so this was just a weekend getaway to Disneyland for us, without having to battle the traffic to and from Anaheim.  We are Wyndham Timeshare owners, so we have only stayed at a handful of WorldMark locations.  The staff was nice and courteous, but was not accommodating in an effort to change our room (we had a second floor unit, facing the major street Katella - luckily there wasn't too much street noise).  We had a colorful 2BD unit, nicely appointed, but generally smaller than the Wyndham counterparts we hvae stayed at.  It seems like the higher level units with a pool view would be nice.  There is one decent sized

We used my nephews timeshare for the week  of October 11th.  Since we drove in on a Monday, there was no problem checking in.  The staff was very friendly and gave us a nice location on the 7th floor.  If you get a room with an even number above the 6th floor you will be facing Disneyland and can see the fireworks from your balcony.    This was my first time in a timeshare and did not know what to expect as far as amenities, so I brought little bottles of dishsoap, detergent and the like. I did not need to bring those since they  had that kind of stuff there.  We just took that back home.  They even had a hairdryer which I didnt expect.  You do need to bring shampoo and conditioners and toiletries, things like that though.    We found a Vons about a mile away and bought

Summary Heading: Had the time of our lives
Summary: Absolutely fantastic. Cannot rave enough. Amenities were excellent. Great internet cafe. The room was just perfect as we had a family of 8. Very spacious and very clean. Location was good as The Garden Walk was just one block from the hotel and Disneyland and California were only a 15 minute walk away. A special thanks to Gary Taylor who was just so nice and very informative. Would recommend this hotel for all.

The resort was very nice.  The staff was helpful and they weren't very pushy when it came to wanting to pitch us on the timeshare.  I was there with my girlfriend and we had a one bedroom suite.  The suite was clean and overall the resort was in excellent shape.  My only complaint was the elevator, which was insanely slow.  But I was on vacation so I wasn't in a hurry to get anywhere.  Also if you aren't on a family vacation, this is not the place to stay.  The pool was always filled with kids.  There were families everywhere you went.  It didn't bother us because we had easy access to I5 and could get around very easily.  But if you're not looking for a family vacation, this isn't the place for you.  It's really close to Disneyland and the Gardenwalk is within walking distance

We stayed here for four days with our two kids.  Our room was tucked in the corner which provided us with beautiful views of California Adventure from the furnished balcony.  After the park closed my hubby and I would enjoy a class of wine and watch the Sun Wheel lights from there.  The size of the one-bedroom unit was great for our family of four.  Prior to arrival we purchased breakfast items from a nearby Ralph's to cut costs at Disneyland.  The parking is directly next door, free and convenient.  Many people came back in the evening to swim and bbq in the large pool area.  It was nice to use the free business center to check in at work occasionally.  We used the ART shuttle the first three days and drove to Disney after we checked out.  Pros - proximity to Disney parks, this

Summary Heading: Great location, good amenities, expected more from a new resort
Summary: We only stayed for one night in early September 2010, we needed to spend one night in town and as Worldmark owners we were able to book one night bonus time in a two bedroom two bath unit.  We had high expectations because the resort is new and the photos look fabulous, and we were surprised to find cheap quality kitchens and appliances.   Like other reviewers said, the elevators were slow and oversolicited (not enough of them), and also we had a noisy unit facing Katella, I would avoid the location facing that major street, you could really hear the cars outside, especially from the third floor.  Otherwise all was good - the beds were firm, which we liked, parking garage next door was large and convenient, customer service seemed very good from the little time we spent there,

Pros: -Close proximity to Disneyland.  It's a short three minutes by car from the parking structure to Harbor Blvd and Disneyland parking.  There are ticket machines in the lobby selling tickets for the shuttle that stops on the corner that will bring you to parks. Summary: We just returned from a week visit at this property.  We were guests of owners.  We own another timeshare property/exchange and travel frequently through it.  I have used our experience at other condos in order to rate this stay at Worldmark by Wyndham Anaheim.  The location is great.  About a 10-15 minute walk to Disneyland.  There is also a shuttle that you can purchase tickets in the lobby for (Anaheim Resort Transportation) that will take you directly there.  The service was great.  Staff was very friendly.  Our unit was a one bedroom and we were assigned a handicap room.  We didn't really mind but also didn't really see where it would accomodate a handicap person. The ART transportation system is easy and affordable, but was often very crowded. I stayed at The Worldmark April 10 thru 17th.  It was great.  I had read all the reviews and was a little hesitant about the view of the unit and the elevator.  I had to wait for the elevator approx. 3 minutes a couple of times was all.  The elevators are extremely fast.  The unit was in great condition and very comfortable.  I was on the 10th floor.  I had a wonderful view.  I could see both Disney parks and overlooked the pool.  We watched the fireworks each night from our balcony.  On the roof there is two hot tubs.
