Summary Heading: What a fantastic place to stay
Summary: My husband and I, and two friends stayed in Worldmark, Anaheim after a Panama Canal cruise.  What a fantastic place to stay.  The apartment was lovely, 2 bedrooms, loungeroom with adjoining kitchen and dining room.  We had views over the pool and Disneyland on the ninth floor.  Fantastic position to watch the fireworks from Disneyland.    The main thing that made our stay so special and memorable were the staff.  To Michelle, Ashley and Buck and to all the others that work there - Thank you.  You made our time there fantastic.  We hope to return one day.

Summary Heading: Great rooms, terrific location, good service
Summary: We stayed here for a week as guests of an owner.  We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath room, with living room, kitchen/dining area.  It was great for our family of four, with one king bed in one room, and 2 twin beds in the other.  We had plenty of room to spread out, and relax after long days of sightseeing.  Beds were okay, but not the most comfortable.  Rooms were very clean, and had most everything we needed.  I had ordered some grocery items from Vons, and had them delivered free to the room on the day we arrived.  It was nice to arrive, and have it all put away and waiting for us. Summary Heading: Great place - love being a trendwest member
Summary: Cannot complain another fantastic worldmark by trendwest property. Staff were friendly room was clean and we loved anaheim

Summary Heading: What we expected - based on TripAdvisor rewiews - no surprises.
Summary: We stayed in a two bedroom unit the week before Thanksgiving. One bedroom was a queen sized bed, second bedroom had two twins.  Two bathrooms - again - lots of room.  Room looked out on the pool - could get a bit noisy at times in the evening.  We requested as low of a floor as possible to avoid the problems with the elevator wait times.  Maybe if you were higher up (top floor is 14), the pool noise would not be that big of a deal.    We toured the two bedroom Presidential Suite.  Very  nice.  Granite countertops, tons of room, stainless steel appliances.  This compared to our unit that had economy appliances and standard countertops.  I'm not complaining - just comparing. So lost a lot of time waiting for the to get ready. They dont have too much cleaning staff. I saw some of them running on the hallway trying to clean the room fast. They should hire more people.

Summary Heading: Except for the elevators and the bathrub, a great place to stay
Summary: I've stayed at Worldmark Anaheim twice in the past six months: four nights in a studio unit in February and one week in a one-bedroom in May.  I agree with what the other posters have stated.  Worldmark is a class operation.  The units were impeccably clean on arrival.  Reception staff were always incredibly friendly but in both cases we were required to wait long after the stated checkin time in order to get our rooms.  On the May trip, we were on the 7th floor with a view of the Disney parks.  Just such a great feeling to look out and see Mickey's face on the ferris wheel every day. Summary Heading: Great location, Awesome view of Disneyland, Great place to stay.
Summary: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Worldmark Anaheim.    This time share has been around now for about six months or so.    The one bedroom unit Worldmark gave us had a broken climate control and we called it in. The employees were very courteous and offered to come right up and fix our climate control or upgrade our room to a better view of Disneyland.    We chose the better view and moved to a different one bedroom unit. We couldn't have had a better experience with this place. All the employees are very courteous, the one bedroom unit is furnished very contemporary and very very clean. Summary: I just returned from a four night stay at this new resort and I must say that I am really impressed. I know many long time WM members are disappointed in how many points it takes to rent a room here but I loved this resort and found the number of credits it took to stay here, worth it. The entire staff was friendly and really helpful.
